text: These are the words that Moses spoke to all of Israel on the other side of the Jordan in the desert, in the desert plateau opposite Suph, between Paran and between Tophel and Laban and Hazeroth and Dizahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a journey of eleven days from Herob by the way of Mount Seir up to Kadesh Barnea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was in the fortieth year, on the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, Moses spoke to the Israelites according to all that Yahweh had instructed him to speak to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened after defeating Sihon king of the Amorites, who was reigning in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, who was reigning in Ashtaroth in Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the other side of the Jordan in the land of Moab Moses began to explain this law, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yahweh our God spoke to us at Horeb, saying, ‘You have stayed long enough at this mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn now and move on, and go into the hill of the Amorites and to all of the neighboring regions in the Jordan Valley in the hill country and in the Negev and in the coastal area along the sea, into the land of the Canaanites and into the Lebanon, as far as the great river Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look, I have set the land before you; go and take possession of the land that Yahweh swore to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give it to them and to their offspring after them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I spoke to them at that time, saying, ‘I am not able to bear you alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God has multiplied you, and look; you are today as the stars of the heaven in number.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh, the God of your ancestors, may he add to you as you are now a thousand times, and may he bless you just as he promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can I bear you by myself, your burden and your load and your strife?
speaker: Narrator

text: Choose for yourselves wise and discerning and knowledgeable men for each of your tribes, and I will appoint them as your leaders.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you answered me, and you said, ‘The thing you have said to do is good.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And so I took the leaders of your tribes, wise and knowledgeable men, and then I appointed them as leaders over you as commanders of groups of thousands and commanders of groups of hundreds and commanders of groups of fifties and commanders of groups of tens as officials for your tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at that time I instructed your judges, saying, ‘hear out your fellow men, and then judge fairly between a man and between his brother and between his opponent who is a resident alien.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must not be partial in your judgment; hear out the small person as also the great person; do not be intimidated by any person, because the judgment is God’s; and the case that is too difficult for you, bring it to me, and I will hear it out.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And so I instructed you at that time concerning all of the things that you should do.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then we set out from Horeb, and we went through the whole of that great and terrible desert that you saw on the way to the hill country of the Amorites as Yahweh our God had commanded us, and so we came up to Kadesh Barnea.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said to you, ‘You have reached the hill country of the Amorites that Yahweh our God is giving to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, Yahweh your God has set before you the land; go up and possess it as Yahweh the God of your ancestors said to you; do not fear and do not be dismayed.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then all of you approached me, and you said, ‘Let us send men before us, and let them explore the land for us, and let them bring back a report to us concerning the way that we should take and concerning the cities that we shall come to.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The plan was good in my opinion, and so I took from among you twelve men, one from each tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they set out and went up into the hill country, and they went up to the wadi of Eschol, and they spied out the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took in their hands some of the fruit of the land, and they brought it down to us, and they brought to us back a report, and they said, ‘The land that Yahweh our God is giving to us is good.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you were not willing to go up, and you rebelled against the command of Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you grumbled in your tents, and you said, ‘Because of the hatred of Yahweh toward us he has brought us out from the land of Egypt to give us into the hand of the Amorites to destroy us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where can we go up? Our brothers have made our hearts melt, saying, “The people are greater and taller than we are, and there are great fortified cities reaching up to heaven, and we saw the sons of the Anakites living there.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And so I said to you, ‘Do not be terrified, and do not fear them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God, who is going before you, will himself fight for you, just as he did for you in Egypt before your eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: and just as he did in the wilderness when you saw that Yahweh your God carried you, just as someone carries his son, all along the way that you traveled until you reached this place.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But through all of this you did not trust in Yahweh your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who goes before you on your way, seeking a place for your encampment, in fire at night and in a cloud by day, to show you the way that you should go.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then Yahweh heard the sound of your words, and he was angry, and he swore, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘No one of these men of this evil generation will see the good land that I swore to give to your ancestors,
speaker: Narrator

text: except Caleb, the son of Jephunneh; he himself shall see it, and to him I will give the land upon which he has trodden and to his sons because he followed Yahweh unreservedly.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Even with me Yahweh was angry because of you, saying, ‘Not even you shall enter there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua, the son of Nun, your assistant, will go there; encourage him because he will cause Israel to inherit it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your little children, who you thought shall become plunder, and your sons, who do not today know good or bad, shall themselves go there, and I will give it to them, and they shall take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you turn and set out in the direction of the wilderness by way of the Red Sea.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “You replied and said to me, ‘We have sinned against Yahweh, and now we will go up and fight according to all that Yahweh our God commanded us’; and so each man fastened on his battle gear, and you regarded it as easy to go up into the hill country.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Yahweh said to me, ‘Say to them, “You shall not go up, and you shall not fight because I am not in your midst; you will be defeated before your enemies.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: So I spoke to you, but you did not listen; you rebelled against the command of Yahweh; you behaved presumptuously, and you went up into the hill country.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Amorites living in the hill country went out to oppose you and chased you as a swarm of wild honey bees do; and so they beat you down in Seir as far as Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you returned and wept before Yahweh; but Yahweh did not listen to your voice and did not pay any attention to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You stayed in Kadesh many days; such were the days that you stayed there.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then we turned and set out toward the wilderness in the direction of the Red Sea, as Yahweh told me, and we went around Mount Seir for many days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh spoke to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Long enough you have been skirting this mountain; turn yourselves north,
speaker: Narrator

text: and instruct the people, saying, “You are about to cross through the territory of your brothers, the descendants of Esau, who are living in Seir; they will be afraid of you, and so be very careful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not get involved in battle with them, for I will not give you any of their land, not even a foot’s breadth of it; since I have given Mount Seir as a possession for Esau.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall buy food from them so that you may eat; and also you shall purchase water from them with money so that you may drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fact of the matter is, Yahweh your God has blessed you in all the work you have done; he knows your travels with respect to this great wilderness; forty years Yahweh your God has been with you; you have not lacked a thing.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: And so we passed by our brothers, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, past the road of the Arabah, from Elath and Ezion Geber, and we turned and traveled along the route of the desert of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to me, ‘You shall not attack Moab, and you shall not engage in war with them, for I will not give you any of his land as a possession; I have given Ar to the descendants of Lot as a possession.’
speaker: Narrator

text: (The Emim previously lived in it, a people large, numerous, and tall, like the Anakites.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were reckoned also as Rephaim as the Anakites were; but the Moabites called them Emim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Horites previously lived in Seir, but the descendants of Esau dispossessed them and destroyed them from among themselves, as Israel did with respect to the land of their possession that Yahweh gave to them.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So now arise and cross over the wadi of Zered yourselves; and so we crossed the wadi of Zered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the length of time that we had traveled from Kadesh Barnea until the time when we crossed the wadi of Zered was thirty-eight years, until the perishing of all of that generation; that is, the men of war from the midst of the camp as Yahweh had sworn to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hand of Yahweh was against them to root them out from the midst of the camp until they perished completely.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And then when all the men of war had died from among the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh spoke to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You are about to cross over the boundary of Moab today at Ar.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you approach the border of the Ammonites, you shall not harass them, and you shall not get involved in battle with them, for I have not given the land of the Ammonites to you as a possession; because I have given it to the descendants of Lot as a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: (It is also considered the land of Rephaim; Rephaim lived in it previously, and the Ammonites called them Zamzummim,
speaker: Narrator

text: a people great and numerous and as tall as the Anakites; Yahweh destroyed them from before them, and they dispossessed them and settled in place of them,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as he did for the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, when he destroyed the Horites from before them and dispossessed them, and then they settled in their place up to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also the Avvites, who lived in villages as far as Gaza, and the Caphtorim, who came out from Caphtor, destroyed them and then settled in their place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, set out and cross over the wadi of Arnon. Look! I have given Sihon the Amorite, the king of Heshbon, and his land into your hand; begin to take possession of it, and engage with him in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: This day I will begin to place the dread of you and the fear of you before the peoples under all the heavens. They will hear the report about you, and so they will shake and tremble because of you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “So I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon king of Heshbon; I sent terms of peace, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Let me cross through your land and only along the road I will go; I will not turn aside to the right or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Food for money you shall sell me, so that I may eat, and water for money you will give to me, so that I may drink; just let me cross on foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as the descendants of Esau did for me, who live in Seir, and the Moabites, who live in Ar, until I cross the Jordan into the land that Yahweh our God is giving to us.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But Sihon king of Heshbon was not willing to let us cross through his territory because Yahweh your God hardened his spirit and made him obstinate in order to give him into your hand, just as he has now done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to me, ‘Look! I have begun to give over to you Sihon and his land; begin to take possession of his land.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Sihon and all his people came out to meet us for battle at Jahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so Yahweh our God gave him over to us, and we struck him down, and his sons and all of his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we captured all of his cities at that time, and we destroyed each town of males and the women and the children; we did not leave behind a survivor.
speaker: Narrator

text: We took only the livestock as spoil for ourselves, and also the booty of the cities that we had captured.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Aroer, which is on the edge of the wadi of Arnon and the city that was in the wadi on up to Gilead, there was not a city that was inaccessible to us; Yahweh our God gave everything to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the land of the Ammonites you did not approach, all along the whole upper region of the Jabbok River and the towns of the hill country, according to all that Yahweh our God had instructed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then we turned, and we went up the road to Bashan, and Og the king of Bashan came out to meet us, he and all of his army for the battle at Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to me, ‘You should not fear him, for I have given him and all of his army and his land into your hand. And so you will do to him as you did to Sihon the king of the Amorites, who was reigning in Heshbon.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And so Yahweh our God also gave Og the king of Bashan, and all of his army into our hand, and we struck him down until not a survivor remained to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we captured all of his towns at that time; there was not a city that we did not take from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of these were fortified towns with high walls, gates, and bars, apart from very many of the villages of the open country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so we destroyed them just as we had done to Sihon the king of Heshbon; we destroyed utterly each town of males, the women, and the little children.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all of the livestock and the booty of the towns we kept as spoil for ourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And so we took at that time the land from the control of the two kings of the Amorites who were on the other side of the Jordan, from the wadi of Arnon up to Mount Hermon.
speaker: Narrator

text: (The Sidonians called Hermon ‘Sirion,’ and the Amorites called it ‘Senir.’)
speaker: Narrator

text: All of the towns of the plateau and the whole of Gilead and all of Bashan up to Salecah and Edrei, the towns of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For only Og, king of Bashan, was left from the remnant of the Rephaim. Indeed, his bedstead—it was a bedstead of iron. It is in Rabbah of the Ammonites. Nine cubits is its length, and four cubits is its width according to the cubit of a man.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And so we took possession of this land at that time, from Aroer, which is on the edge of the wadi of Arnon, and also half of the hill country of Gilead and its towns I gave to the Reubenites and to the Gadites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the remainder of Gilead and all of Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh, the whole region of Argo. All of that area of Bashan was called the land of the Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jair the descendant of Manasseh acquired the whole region of Argob, up to the boundary of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and he called it, that is Bashan, after his own name, Havvoth Jair, as it still is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also I gave Gilead to Makir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to the Reubenites and to the Gadites I gave, from Gilead up to the wadi of Arnon, the middle of the wadi as a boundary and up to the Jabbok River, the boundary of the Ammonites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Jordan Valley with the Jordan River as its boundary, from Kinnereth up to the Sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, with the slopes of Pisgah toward the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I charged you all at that time when I said, “Yahweh has given you—to all of you—this land to possess. All the warriors shall cross over, ready to fight, before your brothers, the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only your wives and your little children and your livestock (I know that you have much livestock) must stay in your towns that I have given you,
speaker: Narrator

text: until Yahweh shall give rest to your brothers as he did to you, and also they take possession of the land that Yahweh your God is giving to them beyond the Jordan; then they may return, each one to his possession that I have given to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, ‘Your eyes see all that Yahweh your God has done to these two kings; so Yahweh will do to all of the kingdoms where you are about to cross over to.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not fear them, for Yahweh your God is the one fighting for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I pleaded with Yahweh at that time, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Lord Yahweh, you have begun to show your servant your greatness and your strong hand, for what god is there in the heaven or on the earth who can do according to your works and according to your mighty deeds?
speaker: Narrator

text: Let me cross over, please, and let me see the good land that is beyond the Jordan, this good hill country and Lebanon.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh was very angry with me because of you, and he would not listen to me, and Yahweh said, ‘Enough of that from you! You shall not speak to me any longer about this matter!
speaker: Narrator

text: Go up to the top of Pisgah and look around you toward the west, toward the north, and toward the east, and view the land with your eyes, for you will not cross this Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now instruct Joshua and support him and encourage him because he himself will cross over before this people and enable them to inherit the land that you will see.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So we remained in the valley opposite Beth Peor.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now, Israel, listen to the rules and to the regulations that I am teaching you to do, in order that you may live and you may go in and you may take possession of the land that Yahweh, the God of your ancestors, is giving to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must not add to the word that I am commanding you, and you shall not take away from it in order to keep the commands of Yahweh your God that I am commanding you to observe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your eyes have seen what Yahweh did with the case of Baal Peor, for each man that followed after Baal Peor Yahweh your God destroyed from your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, the ones holding fast to Yahweh your God, are all alive today.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I now teach you rules and regulations just as Yahweh my God has commanded me, to observe them just so in the midst of the land where you are going, to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you must observe them diligently, for that is your wisdom and your insight before the eyes of the people, who will hear all of these rules, and they will say, ‘Surely this great nation is a wise and discerning people.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For what great nation has for it a god near to it as Yahweh our God, whenever we call upon him?
speaker: Narrator

text: And what other great nation has for it just rules and regulations just like this whole law that I am setting before you today?
speaker: Narrator

text: “However, take care for yourself and watch your inner self closely, so that you do not forget the things that your eyes have seen, so that they do not slip from your mind all the days of your life; and you shall make them known to your children and to your grandchildren.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the day that you stood before Yahweh your God at Horeb when Yahweh said to me, ‘Summon for me the people so that I can tell them my words, that they may learn to fear me all of the days they are alive on the earth and so that they may teach their children.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And so you came near, and you stood under the mountain, and the mountain was burning with fire up to the heart of the heaven, dark with a very thick cloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh spoke to you from the midst of the fire; you heard a sound of words, but you did not see a form—only a voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he declared to you his covenant, the Ten Commandments, which he charged you to observe, and he wrote them on the two tablets of stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh charged me at that time to teach you rules and regulations for your observation of them in the land that you are about to cross into to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So you must be very careful for yourselves, because you did not see any form on the day Yahweh spoke to you at Horeb from the midst of the fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you do not ruin yourselves and make for yourselves a divine image in a form of any image, a replica of male or female,
speaker: Narrator

text: a replica of any animal that is upon the earth, a replica of any winged bird that flies in the air,
speaker: Narrator

text: a replica of any creeping thing on the ground, a replica of any fish that is in the water below the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And do this so that you do not lift your eyes toward heaven and observe the sun and the moon and the stars, all the host of the heaven, and be led astray and bow down to them and serve them, things that Yahweh your God has allotted to all of the peoples under all of the heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh has taken you and brought you out from the furnace of iron, from Egypt, to be a people of inheritance to him, as it is this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And Yahweh was angry with me because of you, and he swore that I would not cross the Jordan and that I would not go to the good land that Yahweh your God is giving you as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am going to die in this land; I am not going to cross the Jordan, but you are going to cross, and you are going to take possession of this good land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch out for yourselves so that you do not forget the covenant of Yahweh your God that he had made with you and make for yourselves a divine image of the form of anything that Yahweh your God has forbidden,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Yahweh your God is a devouring fire, a jealous God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you have had children and grandchildren and you have grown old in the land and you act corruptly and you make a divine image of the form of anything and you do evil in the eyes of Yahweh your God, thus provoking him to anger,
speaker: Narrator

text: I call to witness against you today the heaven and the earth, that you will perish soon and completely from the land that you are crossing the Jordan into it to take possession of it; you will not live long on it, but you will be completely destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh will scatter you among the peoples, and you will be left few in number among the nations to where Yahweh will lead you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will there serve gods made by human hands, of wood and stone, gods that cannot see and cannot hear and cannot eat and cannot smell.
speaker: Narrator

text: But from there you shall seek Yahweh your God and will find him, if you seek him with all your heart and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: In your distress when all these things have found you in the latter days, then you will return to Yahweh your God, and you will listen to his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God is a compassionate God; he will not abandon you, and he will not destroy you, and he will not forget the covenant of your ancestors that he swore to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yes, ask, please, about former days that preceded you from the day that God created humankind on the earth; ask even from one end of the heaven up to the other end of heaven whether anything ever happened like this great thing or whether anything like it was ever heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Has a people ever heard the voice of God speaking from the midst of the fire, just as you heard it, and lived?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or has a god ever attempted to go to take for himself a nation from the midst of a nation, using trials and signs and wonders and war, with an outstretched arm and with great and awesome deeds, like all that Yahweh your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text: You yourselves were shown this wonder in order for you to acknowledge that Yahweh is the God; there is no other God besides him.
speaker: Narrator

text: From heaven he made you hear his voice to teach you, and on the earth he showed you his great fire, and you heard his words from the midst of the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because he loved your ancestors he chose their descendants after them. And he brought you forth from Egypt with his own presence, by his great strength,
speaker: Narrator

text: to drive out nations greater and more numerous than you from before you, to bring you and to give to you their land as an inheritance, as it is this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall acknowledge today, and you must call to mind that Yahweh is God in heaven above and on the earth beneath. There is no other God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall keep his rules and his commandments that I am commanding you today, so that it may go well for you and for your children after you, and so that you may remain a long time on the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you during all of those days.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses set apart three cities on the other side of the Jordan, toward the east,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order for a manslayer to flee there who has killed his neighbor without intent and was not hating him previously, and so he could flee to one of these cities and be safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set apart Bezer in the wilderness in the land of the plateau of the Reubenites; Ramoth in Gilead of the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan of the Manassites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this is the law that Moses set before the Israelites;
speaker: Narrator

text: these are the legal provisions and the rules and the regulations that Moses spoke to the Israelites when they left Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: beyond the Jordan in the valley opposite Beth Peor in the land of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who was reigning in Heshbon and whom Moses and the Israelites defeated when they came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so they took possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, eastward,
speaker: Narrator

text: from Aroer, which is on the bank of the wadi of Arnon and as far as Mount Sirion; that is, Hermon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all of the Arabah beyond the Jordan, eastward, and as far as the Sea of the Arabah under the slopes of Pisgah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then Moses summoned all of Israel and said to them, “Hear, Israel, the rules and the regulations that I am speaking in your ears today, and you shall learn them, and you must observe them diligently.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was not with our ancestors that Yahweh made this covenant, but with these of us who are here alive today.
speaker: Narrator

text: Face to face Yahweh spoke with you at the mountain from the midst of the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was standing between Yahweh and you at that time to report to you the word of Yahweh, for you were afraid because of the presence of the fire, and so you did not go up the mountain. He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out from the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall not be for you other gods besides me.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not make for yourself a divine image of any type of form that is in the heaven above or that is on the earth beneath or that is in the water under the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not bow down to them, and you shall not serve them, for I, Yahweh your God, am a jealous God, punishing the guilt of fathers upon their children and upon the third and upon the fourth generation of those hating me,
speaker: Narrator

text: but showing loyal love to thousands of those who love me and of those who keep my commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not take up the name of Yahweh your God for a worthless purpose, for Yahweh will not leave unpunished anyone who uses his name for a worthless purpose.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Observe the Sabbath day to make it holy, just as Yahweh your God has commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days you shall work, and you shall do all of your work,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the seventh day is a Sabbath unto Yahweh your God; you shall not do any work, or your son, or your daughter, or your slave, or your slave woman, or your ox, or your donkey, or any of your domestic animals, or your resident alien who is in your towns, so that your slave and your slave woman may rest as you rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God brought you out with a strong hand and with an outstretched arm; therefore, Yahweh your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Honor your father and your mother, as Yahweh your God commanded you, so that it will be good for you in the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘You shall not murder.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘And you shall not commit adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘And you shall not steal.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘And you shall not falsely bear evidence against your neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘And you shall not covet the wife of your neighbor, and you shall not crave the house of your neighbor, his field or his slave or his slave woman or his ox and his donkey or anything that belongs to your neighbor.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “These words Yahweh spoke to your whole assembly at the mountain from the midst of the fire and the very thick cloud with a loud voice, and he did not add anything, and then he wrote them on two tablets of stone and gave them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then when you heard the voice from the midst of the darkness, and as the mountain was burning with fire, and and all the heads of your tribes and your elders approached me,
speaker: Narrator

text: you said, ‘Look, Yahweh our God has shown us his glory and his greatness, and we have heard his voice from the midst of the fire; this day we have seen that God can speak with a human being, yet he remains alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so then why shall we die, for this great fire will consume us if we continue to hear the voice of Yahweh our God any longer, and so we shall die?
speaker: Narrator

text: For who is there of all flesh who has heard the voice of the living God speaking from the midst of the fire as we have heard it and remained alive?
speaker: Narrator

text: You go near and hear everything that Yahweh our God will say; and then you tell us all that Yahweh our God tells you, and we will listen, and we will do it.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And Yahweh heard the sound of your words when you spoke to me, and Yahweh said to me, ‘I have heard the sound of the words of this people that they have spoken to you; they are right with respect to all that they have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: If only they had such a mind’; that is, to fear me and to keep all my commandments at all times, so that it will go well for them and for their children forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go! Say to them, “Return to your tents.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But you stand here with me, and let me tell you all of the commandments and the rules and the regulations that you shall teach them, so that they may do them in the land that I am giving to them to take possession of it.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “So you must be careful to do just as Yahweh your God commanded you; you shall not turn to the right or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: In exactly the path that Yahweh your God has commanded, you must go, so that you may live and it will go well for you and you may live long in the land that you will take possession of.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now this is the commandment, the rules and the regulations, that Yahweh your God charged to teach to you for you to observe in the land that you are about to cross over into to take possession of it,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may revere Yahweh your God by keeping all his statutes and his commandments that I am commanding you, you and your children and grandchildren, all the days of your life and so you may live long lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall hear, Israel, and be careful to observe these instructions, so that it may go well for you and that you may multiply greatly, just as Yahweh, the God of your ancestors, promised you, in a land with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Hear, Israel, Yahweh our God, Yahweh is unique.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall love Yahweh your God with all of your heart and with all of your soul and with all of your might.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these words that I am commanding you today shall be on your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall recite them to your children, and you shall talk about them at the time of your living in your house and at the time of your going on the road and at the time of your lying down and at the time of your rising up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall bind them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be as an emblem between your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall write them on the doorframe of your house and on your gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And then it will happen that when Yahweh your God will bring you to the land that he swore to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give to you large and fine cities that you did not build,
speaker: Narrator

text: and houses full of all sorts of good things that you did not fill, and hewn cisterns that you did not hew, vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant, and you have eaten your fill,
speaker: Narrator

text: then take care for yourself, so that you do not forget Yahweh, who brought you out from the land of Egypt from the house of slavery.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall fear Yahweh your God, and you shall serve him, and by his name you shall swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not go after other gods from the gods of the peoples who are all around you,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Yahweh your God is a jealous god in your midst, so that the anger of Yahweh your God would be kindled, and he would destroy you from the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not put Yahweh your God to the test, as you tested him at Massah.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall diligently keep the commandments of Yahweh your God and his legal provisions and his rules that he has commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall do what is right and good in the eyes of Yahweh, so that it shall go well for you and so that you may go and you may take possession of the good land that Yahweh swore for your ancestors,
speaker: Narrator

text: by driving out all of your enemies before you, just as Yahweh has promised.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When your child asks you in the future, saying, ‘What is the meaning of the legal provisions and the rules and the regulations that Yahweh our God commanded for you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall say to your child, ‘We were slaves of Pharaoh in Egypt, and Yahweh brought us out from Egypt with a strong hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh gave great and awesome signs and wonders in Egypt against Pharaoh and against his entire household in our presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he brought us out from there in order to bring us here to give us the land that he swore to our ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so Yahweh commanded us to observe all of these rules and to revere Yahweh our God for our benefit all the days that we live, as it is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be righteousness for us if we diligently observe and do all of this commandment before Yahweh our God, as he has commanded us.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “When Yahweh your God brings you into the land that you are about to enter into it to take possession of it, and he drives out many nations before you, the Hittites and the Girgashites and the Amorites and the Canaanites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, seven nations mightier and more numerous than you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Yahweh your God will give them over to you and you defeat them, you must utterly destroy them; you shall not make a covenant with them, and you shall not show mercy to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall not intermarry with them; you shall not give your daughter to their son; and you shall not take his daughter for your son.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their sons and daughters will cause your son to turn away from following me, and so they will serve other gods, and the anger of Yahweh would be kindled against you, and he would quickly destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this is what you must do to them: you shall break down their altars, and their stone pillars you shall smash, and their Asherah poles you shall hew down, and you shall burn their idols with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are a holy people for Yahweh your God; Yahweh your God has chosen you to be for him a people, a treasured possession from among all the peoples that are on the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yahweh loved you and chose you not because of your great number exceeding all other peoples, for you are fewer than all of the peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text: but because of the love of Yahweh for you and because of his keeping of the sworn oath that he swore to your ancestors, Yahweh brought you out with a strong hand and redeemed you from the house of slavery, from the hand of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: So know that Yahweh your God, he is God, the trustworthy God, maintaining his covenant and his loyal love with those who love him and with those who keep his commandments to a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text: but repaying those who hate him in their own person to destroy them; he is not slow with those who hate him in their own person; he repays them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so you shall keep the commandment and the rules and the regulations that I am commanding you today to observe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And then because you listen to these regulations and you diligently keep and you do them, then Yahweh your God will maintain his covenant and his loyal love that he swore to your ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will love you, and he will bless you, and he will multiply you, and he will bless the fruit of your womb and the fruit of your soil, your grain, your wine, and your olive oil, and newborn calves of your cattle, and the newborn lambs of your flocks in the land that he swore to your ancestors to give you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall be blessed more than all of the peoples; among you there shall not be sterility and bareness, even among domestic animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh will turn away from you all the illness and all the harmful diseases of Egypt that you experienced; he will not lay them on you, but he will lay them on all of those who hate you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall devour all of the peoples that Yahweh your God is giving to you; you shall not pity them, and you shall not serve their gods, which will be a snare for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you think in your heart, ‘These nations are more numerous than I, so how can I dispossess them?’
speaker: Narrator

text: then remember you must not be afraid of them; you must well remember what Yahweh your God did to Pharaoh and to all of Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text: the great trials that your eyes saw and the signs and the wonders and the workings of the strong hand and the outstretched arm by which Yahweh your God brought you out; so Yahweh your God will do to all of the peoples because of whom you are in fear before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, moreover, Yahweh your God will send the hornets among them until both the survivors and the fugitives are destroyed before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must not be in dread from the presence of them, because Yahweh your God, who is in your midst, is a great and awesome God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh your God will clear away these nations from before you little by little; you will not be able to finish them off quickly, lest the wild animals multiply against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh your God will give them to you, and he will throw them into great panic until they are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he will give their kings into your hand, and you shall blot out their names from under the heaven; anyone will not be able to stand against you until you destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall burn the images of their gods with fire; you shall not covet the silver or gold that is on them, and so you take it for yourself, so that you are not ensnared by it, for it is a detestable thing to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you must not bring a detestable thing into your house, or you will become a thing devoted to destruction like it; you must utterly detest it, and you must utterly abhor it, for it is an object devoted to destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All of the commandments that I am commanding you today you must diligently observe, so that you may live and multiply, and you may go and take possession of the land that Yahweh swore to your ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall remember all of the way that Yahweh your God led you during these forty years in the desert in order to humble you and to test you to know what is in your heart, whether you would diligently keep his commandments or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he humbled you and let you go hungry, and then he fed you with that which you did not know nor did your ancestors know, in order to make you know that not by bread alone but by all that goes out of the mouth of Yahweh humankind shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your clothing did not wear out on you, and your feet did not swell during these forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you should know with your heart that as a man disciplines his son, so Yahweh your God is disciplining you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you must keep the commandments of Yahweh your God by walking in his ways and by fearing him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God is bringing you to a good land with streams of water, springs and underground water, welling up in the valleys and in the hills,
speaker: Narrator

text: to a land of wheat and barley and vines and fig trees and pomegranate trees, a land of olive trees, olive oil and honey;
speaker: Narrator

text: to a land where you may eat food in it without scarcity; you will not find anything lacking in it, a land where its stones are iron and from its mountains you can mine copper.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will eat, and you will be satisfied, and you will bless Yahweh your God because of the good land that he has given to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take care for yourself so that you not forget Yahweh your God by not keeping his commandments and his regulations and his statutes that I am commanding you today,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest when you have eaten and you are satisfied and you have built good houses and you live in them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and your herds and your flocks have multiplied, and you have accumulated silver and gold, and all that you have has multiplied,
speaker: Narrator

text: then your heart becomes proud and you forget Yahweh your God, the one who brought you out from the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery,
speaker: Narrator

text: the one leading you in the great and terrible desert infested with dangerous snakes and scorpions and parched ground, where there is no water, and the one bringing out water for you from flint rock,
speaker: Narrator

text: the one feeding you manna in the desert, food that your ancestors did not know, in order to humble you and in order to test you so that he could do good to you in the future.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you may think in your heart, ‘My strength and the might of my hand acquired this wealth for me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you must remember Yahweh your God, for he is the one giving you strength to acquire wealth in order to confirm his covenant that he swore to your ancestors as it is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it will happen that if you indeed forget Yahweh your God and you go after other gods and you serve them and you bow down before them, I warn you today that you will surely perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: As with the nations that Yahweh is destroying before you, so you shall perish because you would not obey the voice of Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Hear, Israel, you are about to cross the Jordan today to go to dispossess nations larger and more numerous than you, great cities fortified with high walls,
speaker: Narrator

text: a great and tall people, the sons of the Anakites, whom you know and of whom you have heard it said, ‘Who could stand before the sons of Anak?’
speaker: Narrator

text: You should know today that Yahweh your God is the one crossing ahead of you as a devouring fire; he will destroy them, and he will subdue them before you; so you will dispossess them, and you will destroy them quickly, just as Yahweh promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not say to yourself when Yahweh your God is driving them out before you, saying, ‘Because of my righteousness Yahweh brought me to take possession of this land’; but because of the wickedness of these nations Yahweh is driving them out before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is not because of your righteousness and because of the uprightness of your heart that you are coming to take possession of their land, but because of the wickedness of these nations Yahweh your God is driving them before you, and in order to confirm the promise that Yahweh swore to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So you should understand that it is not because of your righteousness that Yahweh your God is giving you this good land to take possession of it, because you are a stubborn people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, do not forget, that you provoked Yahweh your God in the desert, and from the day that you went out from the land of Egypt until you came to this place you were rebelling against Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And remember at Horeb you provoked Yahweh, and Yahweh became angry enough to destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I went up the mountain to receive the stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant that Yahweh made with you, and remained on the mountain forty days and forty nights, I did not eat food and I did not drink water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh gave me the two tablets of stone written with the finger of God, and on them was writing according to all the words that Yahweh spoke with you at the mountain, from the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then at the end of forty days and forty nights, Yahweh gave me the two tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to me, ‘Come now, go down quickly from this mountain because your people behave corruptly whom you brought out from Egypt, for they turned quickly from the way that I commanded them to follow; they have made for themselves a cast image.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh spoke to me, saying, ‘I have seen this people, and look! They are a stubborn people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Leave me alone, and let me destroy them, and let me blot out their name from under heaven, and let me make you into a nation mightier and more numerous than they!’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I turned, and I went down the mountain, as the mountain was burning with fire, and the two tablets of the covenant were in my two hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I looked, and indeed you had sinned against Yahweh your God; you had made for yourselves an image of a calf of cast metal; you had turned quickly from the way that Yahweh had commanded for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I took hold of the two tablets, and I threw them out of my two hands and smashed them before your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then I lay prostrate before Yahweh, as earlier, forty days and forty nights; I did not eat food and I did not drink water because of all your sins that you committed, by doing evil in the eyes of Yahweh and so provoking him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was in dread from being in the presence of the anger and the wrath with which Yahweh was angry with you so as to destroy you, but Yahweh listened to me also at that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And with Aaron Yahweh was angry enough to destroy him, and I prayed also for Aaron at that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your sinful thing that you had made, the molten calf, I took and I burned it with fire, and I crushed it, grinding it thoroughly until it was crushed to dust, and I threw its dust into the stream that flowed down the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And also at Taberah and at Massah and at Kibroth Hattaavah you provoked Yahweh to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Yahweh sent you out from Kadesh Barnea, saying, ‘Go up and take possession of the land that I have given you,’ you rebelled against the command of Yahweh your God, and you did not believe him, and you did not listen to his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have been rebellious toward Yahweh from the day I have known you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I lay prostrate before Yahweh through forty days, and through forty nights I prostrated myself, because Yahweh intended to kill you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I prayed to Yahweh, and I said, ‘Lord Yahweh, you must not destroy your people and your inheritance whom you redeemed in your greatness, whom you brought out from Egypt with a strong hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; you must not pay attention to the stubbornness of this people, to their wickedness and to their sin,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest the people of the land from which you brought us out from there say, “Because Yahweh was not able to bring them to the land that he promised to them and because of his hatred toward them, he has brought them out to kill them in the desert.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For they are your people and your inheritance whom you brought with your great power and with your outstretched arm.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “At that time Yahweh said to me, ‘Carve for yourself two tablets of stone just as the former ones, and come up the mountain to me, and you shall make for yourself an ark of wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will write on the tablets the words that were on the former tablets, which you smashed, and you must put them in the ark.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And so I made an ark of acacia wood, and I carved two tablets of stone like the former ones, and I went up the mountain with the two tablets in my hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he wrote upon the tablets according to the first writing, the ten words that Yahweh spoke to you on the mountain from the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly, and Yahweh gave them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I turned, and I came down from the mountain, and I put the tablets in the ark that I had made, and they are there, just as Yahweh commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And the Israelites journeyed from the wells of Bene-Yaqan to Moserah; there Aaron died and was buried, and Eleazar, his son, served as a priest in place of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they journeyed to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land flowing with streams of water.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Yahweh set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of Yahweh to stand before Yahweh, to serve him and to bless the people in his name until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore there was not for Levi an allotment or an inheritance along with his brothers; rather Yahweh is his inheritance just as Yahweh your God promised to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I stayed on the mountain just as during the former forty days and forty nights, and Yahweh listened to me also on that occasion; Yahweh was not willing to destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to me, ‘Come, continue your journey before the people, so that you may go and take possession of the land that I swore to their ancestors to give to them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, Israel, what is Yahweh your God asking from you, except to revere Yahweh your God, to go in all his ways and to love him and to serve Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: to keep the commandments of Yahweh and his statutes that I am commanding you today for your own good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look! For to Yahweh your God belong heaven and the highest heavens, the earth and all that is in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet to your ancestors Yahweh was very attached, so as to love them, and so he chose their offspring after them, namely you, from all the peoples, as it is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall circumcise the foreskin of your heart, and do not be stubborn.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God, he is God of the gods and Lord of the lords, the great and mighty God, the awesome one who is not partial, and he does not take bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he executes justice for the orphan and widow, and he is one who loves the alien, to give to them food and clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall love the alien, for you were aliens in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God, you shall revere him, you shall serve him, and to him you shall cling, and by his name you shall swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is your praise, and he is your God, who has done with you these great and awesome things that your eyes have seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: With only seventy persons your ancestors went down to Egypt, but now Yahweh your God has made you as the stars of the heaven with respect to multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you shall love Yahweh your God, and you shall keep his obligations and his statutes and his regulations and his commandments always.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall realize today that it is not with your children who have not known and who have not seen the discipline of Yahweh your God—his greatness, his strong hand, and his outstretched arm,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his signs and his deeds that he did in the midst of Egypt to Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and to all of his land,
speaker: Narrator

text: and what he did to the army of Egypt and to their horses and to their chariots, and how he made the water of the Red Sea flow over them, when they pursued after them, and so Yahweh has destroyed them, as is the case today,
speaker: Narrator

text: and what he did to you in the desert until you came up to this place,
speaker: Narrator

text: and what he did to Dathan and to Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben, how the earth opened its mouth wide and swallowed them, their households and their tents, and all of the living creatures that were in their possession and that were following along with them in the midst of all of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fact of the matter is, your own eyes have seen all of the great deeds of Yahweh that he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you must keep all of the commandments that I am commanding you today, so that you may have strength and you may go and you may take possession of that land to which you are crossing to take possession of it,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may live long on the land that Yahweh swore to your ancestors, to give it to them and to their offspring, a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the fact is that the land that you are about to go into to take possession of it is not like the land of Egypt, from which you have come out of, where you sow your seed and you give water by your foot, as in a vegetable garden.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the land that you are about to cross into to take possession of it is a land of hills and valleys, and by the rain of the heaven it drinks water,
speaker: Narrator

text: a land that Yahweh your God is caring for it; continually the eyes of Yahweh your God are on it, from the beginning of the year up to the end of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And it will happen that if you listen carefully to my commandments that I am commanding you today, to love Yahweh your God, and to serve him with all of your heart and with all of your soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: then ‘I will send the rain for your land in its season, early rain and later rain, and you will gather your grain and your wine and your olive oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give vegetation in your field for your livestock, and you will eat your fill.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Take care so that your heart is not easily deceived, and you turn away, and you serve other gods, and you bow down to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then the anger of Yahweh will be kindled against you, and he will shut up the heavens, and there shall not be rain, and so the ground will not give its produce, and you will perish quickly from the good land that Yahweh is giving to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you shall put these, my words, on your heart and on your inner self, and you shall bind them as a sign on your hand and let them be as an emblem between your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall teach them to your children by talking about them when you sit in your house and when you travel on the road and when you lie down and when you get up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall write them on the doorframes of your house and on your gates,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that they may multiply your days and the days of your children on the land that Yahweh swore to your ancestors to give it to them as long as heaven endures over the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, if you diligently keep all this commandment that I am commanding you to observe it, by loving Yahweh your God by walking in all his ways and by holding fast to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: then Yahweh will drive out all of these nations before you, and you will dispossess nations larger and more numerous than you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every place on which the sole of your foot treads, it shall be yours; your boundary shall be from the desert and Lebanon from the river, the river Euphrates, on up to the western sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one can take a stand against you; your dread and your fear Yahweh your God will put on the surface of all the land where you tread, just as he promised to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “See, I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse:
speaker: Narrator

text: the blessing, if you listen to the commandments of Yahweh your God that I am commanding you today,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the curse, if you do not listen to the commandments of Yahweh your God, but rather you turn from the way that I am commanding you today to go after other gods that you have not known.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And it will happen that when Yahweh your God has brought you to the land that you are going to, to take possession of it, then you shall pronounce the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Are they not beyond the Jordan, toward the west, in the land of the Canaanites living in the Jordan Valley, opposite Gilgal beside the terebinth of Moreh?)
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are now about to cross the Jordan to go to take possession of the land that Yahweh, your God, is giving to you, and you will take possession of it and live in it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you must diligently observe all the rules and the regulations that I am setting before you today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “These are the rules and the regulations that you must diligently observe in the land that Yahweh, the God of your ancestors, has given to you to take possession of it, during all the days that you are living on the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must completely demolish all of the places there where they served their gods, that is, the nations whom you are about to dispossess, on the high mountains, and on the hills and under each leafy green tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall break down their altars, and you shall smash their stone pillars, and their Asherah poles you must burn with fire, and the images of their gods you shall hew down, and you shall blot out their names from that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not worship Yahweh your God like this.
speaker: Narrator

text: But only to the place that Yahweh your God will choose from all of your tribes to place his name there as his dwelling shall you seek, and there you shall go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall bring there your burnt offerings and your sacrifices and your tithes and your donations and your votive gifts and your freewill offerings and the firstling of your herd and your flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall eat there before Yahweh your God, and you shall rejoice in all your endeavors, you and your family in which Yahweh your God has blessed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You must not do just as we are doing here today, each according to all that is right in his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have not come up to now to the resting place and to the inheritance that Yahweh your God is giving to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you will cross the Jordan, and you will settle in the land that Yahweh your God is giving you as an inheritance, and he will give rest to you from all your enemies from all around, and you will live securely,
speaker: Narrator

text: and then at the place that Yahweh your God will choose, to let his name dwell there, there you shall bring all the things I am commanding you, your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and your donations, and all of the choice things, your votive gifts that you vow to Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God, you and your sons and your daughters and your slaves and your slave women and the Levite who is in your towns, because there is not for him a plot of ground and an inheritance with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take care for yourself so that you do not offer your burnt offerings at just any place that you happen to see,
speaker: Narrator

text: but only at the place that Yahweh will choose among one of your tribes; there you shall offer your burnt offerings, and there you shall do all the things that I am commanding you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But whenever you desire you may slaughter, and you may eat meat according to the blessing of Yahweh your God that he has given to you in all of your towns; the unclean and the clean may eat it just as they would the gazelle and as the deer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the blood you must not eat, but on the ground you must pour it like water.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not allowed to eat in your towns the tithe of your grain and your wine and your olive oil and the firstborn of your herd and your flock and all of your votive gifts that you vowed and your freewill offering and your donations.
speaker: Narrator

text: But only before Yahweh your God you shall eat it, at the place that Yahweh your God will choose, you and your son and your daughter and your slave and your slave woman and the Levite who is in your towns, and you must rejoice before your God in all your undertakings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take care so that you do not neglect the Levite all of your days on your land.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When Yahweh your God enlarges your territory just as he has promised to you, and you say ‘I want to eat some meat,’ because you want it, whenever you desire you may eat meat.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the place that Yahweh your God will choose to put his name there is too far from you, and you slaughter any of your herd and any of your flock that Yahweh has given to you just as I have commanded you, then you may eat whenever you desire in your towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely just as the gazelle and the deer is eaten, so both the unclean and the clean together may eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only, be sure not to eat the blood, because the blood is the life, and you shall not eat the life with the meat.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat it, but on the ground you shall pour it out like water.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat it, so that it will go well for you and your children after you, because then you will be doing what is right in the eyes of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only your holy objects that are yours and your votive gifts you must carry and you must bring to the place that Yahweh will choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood on the altar of Yahweh your God, and the blood of your sacrifices you shall pour out on the altar of Yahweh your God, but the meat you may eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be careful to obey all these things that I am commanding you, so that it will go well for you and for your children after you forever, because then you will be doing what is good and right in the eyes of Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When Yahweh your God has cut off the nations whom you are about to go to, to dispossess them before you, and you have dispossessed them, and you live in their land,
speaker: Narrator

text: take care so that you are not ensnared into imitating them after their being destroyed from before you, and so that you not enquire concerning their gods, saying, ‘How did these nations serve their gods, and thus I myself want to do also.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You must not do so toward Yahweh your God, because of every detestable thing they have done for their gods Yahweh hates, for even their sons and their daughters they would burn in the fire to their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of the things that I am commanding you, you must diligently observe; you shall not add to it, and you shall not take away from it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a prophet stands up in your midst or a dreamer of dreams and he gives to you a sign or wonder,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sign or the wonder comes about that he spoke to you, saying, ‘Let us go after other gods (those whom you have not known), and let us serve them,’
speaker: Narrator

text: you must not listen to the words of that prophet or to that dreamer, for Yahweh your God is testing you to know whether you love Yahweh your God with all of your heart and with all of your inner self.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall go after Yahweh your God, and him you shall revere, and his commandment you shall keep, and to his voice you shall listen, and him you shall serve, and to him you shall hold fast.
speaker: Narrator

text: But that prophet or the dreamer of that dream shall be executed, for he spoke falsely about Yahweh your God, the one bringing you out from the land of Egypt and the one redeeming you from the house of slavery, in order to seduce you from the way that Yahweh your God commanded you to go in it; so in this way you shall purge the evil from your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If your brother, the son of your mother or your son or your daughter or your wife whom you embrace or your intimate friend in secrecy says, ‘Let us go and let us serve other gods!’ gods that you and your ancestors have not known,
speaker: Narrator

text: from among the gods of the people who are around you, those near you or those far from you, from one end of the earth and up to the other end of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: you must not give in to him, and you shall not listen to him, and your eye shall not take pity on him, and you shall not have compassion, and you shall not cover up for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall certainly kill him; your hand shall be first against him to kill him and next the hand of all of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall stone him with stones and let him die, for he tried to seduce you from Yahweh your God, the one bringing you from the land of Egypt, from the house of slavery.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all of Israel shall hear, and they shall fear, and they shall not continue to act according to this evil thing in your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you hear in one of your towns which Yahweh your God is giving to you to live in, someone saying that
speaker: Narrator

text: worthless men have gone out from your midst and have seduced the inhabitants of their town, saying, ‘Let us go and serve other gods!’ whom you have not known,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall inquire and examine and interrogate thoroughly, and, look! It is true; the thing has actually been done, this detestable thing in your midst,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall certainly strike down the inhabitants of that town with the edge of the sword; you shall destroy it and everything in it, its domestic animals with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then you shall gather all of its booty into the middle of its public square, and you shall burn the town and all of its war-booty totally for Yahweh your God, and it shall be a pile of rubble forever; it shall not be built again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let not something cling to your hand from the things devoted to destruction, so that Yahweh may turn back from his burning anger, and he may show compassion to you and he may continue to show compassion and so multiply you just as he swore to your ancestors,
speaker: Narrator

text: if you listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, to keep all of his commandments that I am commanding to you today so as to do the right thing in the eyes of Yahweh your God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are children of Yahweh your God; therefore you must not gash yourself, and you must not make your forehead bald for the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are a people holy to Yahweh your God, and you Yahweh has chosen to be a treasured possession from among all of the peoples that are on the surface of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat any detestable thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the animals you may eat: ox, sheep, goats,
speaker: Narrator

text: deer, gazelle, roebuck, wild goat, ibex, antelope, and mountain sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And any animal having a split hoof and so a dividing of the hoof into two parts and that chews the cud among the animals—that animal you may eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only these you may not eat from those chewing the cud and from those having a division of the hoof: the camel and the hare and the coney, because they chew the cud, but they do not divide the hoof; they are therefore unclean for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also the pig because it has a division of the hoof but does not chew the cud; it is unclean for you; from their meat you shall not eat, and you shall not touch their carcasses.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is what you shall eat from all that is in the water: everything that has fins and scales you may eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But anything that does not have fins and scales, you may not eat, for it is unclean for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All of the birds that are clean you may eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the ones you shall not eat any of them: the eagle and the vulture and the short-toed eagle,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the red kite and the black kite or any kind of falcon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and any kind of crow according to its kind,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the ostrich and the short-eared owl and the seagull and the hawk according to its kind,
speaker: Narrator

text: the little owl and the great owl and the barn owl,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the desert owl and the carrion vulture and the cormorant,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the stork and the heron according to its kind and the hoopoe and the bat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also all of the winged insects; they are unclean for you; you shall not eat them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may eat any clean bird.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not eat any carcass; you may give it to the alien who is in your towns, and he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner, for you are a holy people for Yahweh your God; you may not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Certainly you must give a tithe of all the yield of your seed, which comes forth from your field year after year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall eat before Yahweh your God in the place that he will choose to make to dwell his name there the tithe of your grain, your wine and your olive oil and the firstling of your herd and your flock, so that you may learn to revere Yahweh your God always.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the distance is too great for you, so that you are not able to transport it, because the place that Yahweh your God will choose to set his name there, it is too far from you, when Yahweh your God will bless you,
speaker: Narrator

text: then in that case you may exchange for money, and you shall take the money to your hand and go to the place that Yahweh your God will choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may spend the money for anything that you desire, for oxen or for sheep or for wine or for strong drink or for anything that you desire, and you shall eat it there before Yahweh your God, and you shall rejoice, you and your household.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as to the Levite who is in your towns, you shall not neglect him, because there is not a plot of ground for him and an inheritance along with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At the end of three years you shall bring out all of the tithe of your yield for that year, and you shall store it in your towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so the Levite may come, because there is no plot of ground for him or an inheritance with you, and the alien also may come and the orphan and the widow that are in your towns, and they may eat their fill, so that Yahweh your God may bless you in all of the work of your hand that you undertake.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “At the end of seven years you shall grant a remission of debt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the manner of the remission of debt: every creditor shall remit his claim that he holds against his neighbor, and he shall not exact payment from his brother because there a remission of debt has been proclaimed unto Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: With respect to the foreigner you may exact payment, but you must remit what shall be owed to you with respect to your brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, there shall not be among you a poor person, because Yahweh will certainly bless you in the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you as an inheritance, to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: If only you listen well to the voice of Yahweh your God by observing diligently all of these commandments that I am commanding you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Yahweh your God has blessed you, just as he promised to you, then you will lend to many nations, but you will not borrow from them, and you will rule over many nations, but they will not rule over you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there is a poor person among you from among one of your brothers in one of your towns that Yahweh your God is giving to you, you shall not harden your heart, and you shall not shut your hand toward your brother who is poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall certainly open your hand for him, and you shall willingly lend to him enough to meet his need, whatever it is.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take care so that there will not be a thought of wickedness in your heart, saying, ‘The seventh year, the year of the remission of debt is near,’ and you view your needy neighbor with hostility, and so you do not give to him, and he might cry out against you to Yahweh, and you would incur guilt against yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: By all means you must give to him, and you must not be discontented at your giving to him, because on account of this very thing, Yahweh your God will bless you in all your work and in all that you undertake.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the poor will not cease to be among you in the land; therefore I am commanding you, saying, ‘You shall willingly open your hand to your brother, to your needy and to your poor that are in your land.’
speaker: Narrator

text: If your relative who is a Hebrew man or a Hebrew woman is sold to you, and he or she has served you six years, then in the seventh year you shall send that person out free.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you send him out free from you, you shall not send him away empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall generously supply him from among your flocks and from your threshing floor and from your press; according to that with which Yahweh your God has blessed you, you shall give to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God redeemed you; therefore I am commanding you thus today.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then if it will happen that he says to you, ‘I do not want to go out from you,’ because he loves you and your family, because it is good for him to be with you;
speaker: Narrator
