text: then you shall take an awl, and you shall thrust it through his earlobe and into the door, and he shall be to you a slave forever; and you shall also do likewise for your slave woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not be hard in your eyes when you send him forth free, because for six years he has served you worth twice the wage of a hired worker; and Yahweh your God will bless you in whatever you will do.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Every firstling male that is born of your herd and of your flock you shall consecrate to Yahweh your God; you shall not do work with the firstling of your ox, and you shall not shear the firstling of your flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rather before Yahweh your God you shall eat it year by year at the place Yahweh will choose, you and your household.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if there is a physical defect in it, such as lameness or blindness, any serious defect, you shall not sacrifice it to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: In your towns you shall eat it, the unclean and the clean together may eat it, just as they eat the gazelle and as they eat the deer.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall not eat its blood; you shall pour it on the ground like water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Observe the month of Abib, and you shall keep the Passover to Yahweh your God, for in the month of Abib Yahweh your God brought you out from Egypt by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall offer the Passover sacrifice to Yahweh your God from among your flock and herd at the place that Yahweh will choose, to let his name dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat with it anything leavened; seven days you shall eat with it unleavened bread of affliction, because in haste you went out from the land of Egypt, so that you will remember the day of your going out from the land of Egypt all the days of your life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And leaven shall not be seen with you in any of your territory for seven days, and none of the meat that you will slaughter on the evening on the first day shall remain overnight until morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not allowed to offer the Passover sacrifice in one of your towns that Yahweh your God is giving to you,
speaker: Narrator

text: but only at the place that Yahweh your God will choose, to let his name dwell there; you shall offer the Passover sacrifice in the evening at sunset, at the designated time of your going out from Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall cook, and you shall eat it at the place that Yahweh your God will choose; and you may turn in the morning and go to your tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be an assembly for Yahweh your God; you shall not do work.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall count off seven weeks for you; from the time you begin to harvest the standing grain you shall begin to count seven weeks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then you shall celebrate the Feast of Weeks for Yahweh your God with the measure of the freewill offering of your hand that you shall give just as Yahweh your God has blessed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God, you and your son and your daughter and your slave and your slave woman and the Levite that is in your towns and the alien and the orphan and the widow who are in your midst in the place that Yahweh your God will choose to let his name dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and so you shall diligently observe these rules.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall celebrate the Feast of Booths for yourselves seven days at the gathering in of the produce from your threshing floor and from your press;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall rejoice at your feast, you and your son and your daughter and your slave and your slave woman and the Levite and the orphan and the widow that are in your towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven days you shall celebrate your feast to Yahweh your God at the place Yahweh will choose, for Yahweh your God shall bless you in all of your produce and in all of the work of your hand, and you shall surely be rejoicing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times in the year all of your males shall appear before Yahweh your God at the place that he will choose, at the Feast of Unleavened Bread and at the Feast of Weeks and at the Feast of Booths, and they shall not appear before Yahweh empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each person shall give as he is able, that is, according to the blessing of Yahweh your God that he has given to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall appoint judges and officials for you in all your towns that Yahweh your God is giving to you throughout your tribes, and you shall render for the people righteous judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not subvert justice; you shall not show partiality; and you shall not take a bribe, for the bribe makes blind the eyes of the wise and misrepresents the words of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Justice, only justice you shall pursue, so that you may live, and you shall take possession of the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not plant for yourselves an Asherah pole beside the altar of Yahweh your God that you make for yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall not set up for yourselves a stone pillar, a thing that Yahweh your God hates.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not sacrifice to Yahweh your God an ox or sheep that has a physical defect of anything seriously wrong, for that is a detestable thing to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there is found in one of your towns that Yahweh your God is giving to you a man or a woman that does evil in the eyes of Yahweh your God to transgress his covenant
speaker: Narrator

text: and by going and serving other gods and so he bows down to them and to the sun or to the moon or to any of the host of heaven which I have forbidden,
speaker: Narrator

text: and it is reported to you or you hear about it and you enquire about it thoroughly and, indeed, the trustworthiness of the deed has been established, it has occurred, this detestable thing, in Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall bring out that man or that woman who has done this evil thing to your gates; that is, the man or the woman, and you shall stone them with stones to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the evidence of two or three witnesses the person shall be put to death. The person shall not be put to death by the mouth of one witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hand of the witnesses shall be first against the person to kill the person, and afterward the hands of all the people, and so you shall purge the evil from your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a matter is too difficult for you, for example disputes between blood and blood, between legal claim and legal claim and between assault and assault and between matters of discernment in your towns, then you shall get up and you shall go to the place that Yahweh your God will choose;
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall go to the priests and the Levites and to the judge who will be in office in those days, and you shall enquire, and they shall announce to you the verdict.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you shall carry out exactly the decision that they announced to you from that place that Yahweh will choose, and you shall diligently observe according to all that they instruct you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so according to the instruction of the law that they teach you and according to the decisions that they say to you, you shall do; you shall not turn from the word that they tell you to the right or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man who treats with contempt so as not to listen to the priest who is standing to minister on behalf of Yahweh your God or to the judge, that man shall die; so you shall purge the evil from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people will hear and will be afraid, and they will not behave presumptuously again.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you have come to that land that Yahweh your God is giving to you and you have taken possession of it and you have settled in it, and you say, ‘I will set over me a king like all the nations that are around me,’
speaker: Narrator

text: indeed, you may set a king over you whom Yahweh your God will choose, from the midst of your countrymen you must set a king over you; you are not allowed to appoint over you a man, a foreigner, who is not your countryman.
speaker: Narrator

text: Except, he may not make numerous for himself horses, and he may not allow the people to to go to Egypt in order to increase horses, for Yahweh has said to you that you may never return.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he must not acquire many wives for himself, so that his heart would turn aside; and he must not accumulate silver and gold for himself excessively.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And then when he is sitting on the throne of his kingdom, then he shall write for himself a copy of this law on a scroll before the Levitical priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be with him, and he shall read it all the days of his life, so that he may learn to revere Yahweh your God by diligently observing all the word of this law and these rules,
speaker: Narrator

text: so as not to exalt his heart above his countrymen and not to turn aside from the commandment to the right or to the left, so that he may reign long over his kingdom, he and his children in the midst of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “And there shall not be for the Levitical priests, the whole tribe of Levi, a plot of ground and an inheritance with Israel, rather they may eat an offering made by fire as their inheritance, for Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall not be for them an inheritance of land in the midst of his brothers; rather Yahweh is his inheritance, just as he promised to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this shall be the share of the priest from the people, from those who sacrifice the sacrifice, whether it is an ox, sheep, or goat, and they shall give the priest the shoulder and the jawbones and the stomach.
speaker: Narrator

text: The firstfruits of your grain, your wine, and your olive oil and the firstfruits of the fleece of your sheep you shall give to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God has chosen him from among all your tribes to stand to minister in the name of Yahweh, he and his sons forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a Levite comes from one of your towns from anywhere in Israel where he is residing, he may come whenever he desires, to the place that Yahweh will choose,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he may minister in the name of Yahweh his God, just like all his brothers, the Levites who stand there before Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall eat equal portions, apart from what he may receive from the sale of his patrimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you come to the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you, you must not learn to do like the detestable practices of those nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall not be found among you one who makes his son or his daughter go through the fire, or one who practices divination, or an interpreter of signs, or an augur, or sorcerer,
speaker: Narrator

text: or one who casts magic spells, or one who consults a spirit of the dead, or spiritist, or one who inquires of the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everyone doing these things is detestable to Yahweh, and because of these detestable things Yahweh your God is driving them out from before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must be blameless before Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For these nations that you are about to dispossess listen to interpreters of signs and to diviners, but Yahweh your God has not allowed you to do the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yahweh your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your midst, from your countrymen, and to him you shall listen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is according to all that you asked from Yahweh your God at Horeb, on the day of the assembly, saying, ‘I do not want again to hear the voice of Yahweh my God, and I do not want to see again this great fire, so that I may not die!’
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to me, ‘They are right in what they have said.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will raise up a prophet for them from among their countrymen like you, and I will place my words into his mouth, and he shall speak to them everything that I command him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then the man that will not listen to my words that he shall speak in my name, I will hold accountable.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, the prophet that behaves presumptuously by speaking a word in my name that I have not commanded him to speak, and who speaks in the name of other gods, then that prophet shall die.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you say to yourself, ‘How can we know the word that Yahweh has not spoken to him?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever what the prophet spoke in the name of Yahweh, the thing does not take place and does not come about, that is the thing that Yahweh has not spoken to him. Presumptuously the prophet spoke it; you shall not fear that prophet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “When Yahweh your God has exterminated the nations concerning whom Yahweh your God is giving to you their land, and you have dispossessed them, and you have settled in their towns and in their houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall set apart three cities for you in the midst of your land that Yahweh your God is giving to you to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall prepare the roads for yourselves, and you shall divide the regions of your land into thirds that Yahweh your God gives you as a possession, so that it will be available for any manslayer to flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now this is the case of the manslayer who may flee there and live there who has killed his neighbor unintentionally, and he did not hate him previously.
speaker: Narrator

text: For example, when somebody goes with his neighbor into the forest to cut wood, and the iron head slips from the handle of the tool and strikes his neighbor and he dies, then he may flee to one of these cities, and so he may live.
speaker: Narrator

text: He does this lest the avenger of blood might pursue after the killer, because he is hot with anger and he overtakes him, because it is a long distance to the city of refuge, and so he kills him, but he did not deserve a death sentence, because he was not hating him before.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I am commanding you, saying, ‘You shall set apart three cities.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then if Yahweh your God enlarges your territory just as he swore to your ancestors and gives to you all the land that he promised to give to your ancestors,
speaker: Narrator

text: then if you diligently observe this entire commandment that I am commanding you today by loving Yahweh your God and by going in his ways at all times, then you shall add three more cities for yourselves to these three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do this so that innocent blood will not be shed in the midst of your land that Yahweh your God is giving to you as an inheritance and thereby bloodguilt would be on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if someone hates his neighbor and lies in wait for him and rises up against him and murders him, and the murderer flees to one of these cities,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the elders of his city shall send and take him from there, and they shall give him into the hand of the avenger of blood, and he shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your eye shall not take pity on him, and you shall purge the guilt of innocent blood from Israel, so that good will be directed toward you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not move the boundary marker of your neighbor that former generations set up on your property in the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The testimony of a single witness may not be used to convict with respect to any crime and for any wrongdoing in any offense that a person committed; on the evidence of two witnesses or on the evidence of three witnesses a charge shall be sustained.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a malicious witness gets up to accuse anyone to testify against him falsely,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the two men to whom the legal dispute pertains shall stand before Yahweh, before the priests and the judges who are in office in those days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then judges shall make a thorough inquiry, and if it turns out that the witness is a false witness and he testified falsely against his brother,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall do to him as he meant to do to his brother, and so you shall purge the evil from your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest shall hear and shall fear, and they shall not continue to do such a thing again as this evil thing in your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must show no pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you go out to war against your enemies and you see a horse and a chariot, an army larger that you, you shall not be afraid because of them; for Yahweh your God is with you, the one who brought you from the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then when you approach the battle, then the priest shall come near and speak to the troops.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall say to them, ‘Hear, Israel, you are near today to the battle against your enemies; do not lose heart; you shall not be afraid, and you shall not panic, and you shall not be terrified because of them,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Yahweh your God is going with you to fight for you against your enemies to help you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the officials shall speak to the troops, saying, ‘Who is the man who has built a new house and has not dedicated it? Let him go and return to this house, so that he does not die in battle and another man dedicates it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And who is the man that has planted a vineyard and has not enjoyed it? Let him go and let him return to his house, so that he does not die in battle and another man enjoys it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And who is the man who got engaged to a woman and has not married her? Let him go and let him return to his house, so that he does not die in battle and another man marries her.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the officials shall continue to speak to the troops, and they shall say, ‘What man is afraid and disheartened? Let him go, and let him return to his house, and let him not cause the heart of his brothers to melt like his.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the officials have finished speaking to the army troops, then they shall appoint commanders of divisions at the head of the troops.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you approach a city to fight against it, you must offer it peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then if they accept your terms of peace and they surrender to you, and then all the people inhabiting it shall be forced labor for you, and they shall serve you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they do not accept your terms of peace and they want to make war with you, then you shall lay siege against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh your God will give it into your hand, and you shall kill all its males with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the women and the little children and the domestic animals and all that shall be in the city, all of its spoil you may loot for yourselves, and you may enjoy the spoil of your enemies that Yahweh you God has given to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you shall do to all the far cities from you, which are not from the cities of these nations located nearby.
speaker: Narrator

text: But from the cities of these peoples that Yahweh your God is giving to you as an inheritance, you shall not let anything live that breathes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rather, you shall utterly destroy them, the Hittites and the Amorites, the Canaanites and the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, just as Yahweh your God has commanded you,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that they may not teach you to do like all their detestable things that they do for their gods and thereby you sin against Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you besiege a town for many days to make war against it in order to seize it, you shall not destroy its trees by wielding an ax against them, for you may eat from them, and so you must not cut them down. Are the trees of the field humans that they should come in siege against you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the trees that you know are not fruit trees you may destroy and you may cut down, and you may build siege works against that city that is making war with you until it falls.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “If someone slain is found in the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you to take possession of it and is lying in the field, and it is not known who killed him,
speaker: Narrator

text: then your elders and your judges shall go out and shall measure the distance to the cities that are around the slain one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then the nearest city to the slain one, the elders of that city shall take a heifer of the herd that has not been worked with in the field, that has not pulled a yoke,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the elders of that city shall bring the heifer down to a wadi that flows with water all year and that has not been plowed and has not been sown; then there they shall break the neck of the heifer in the wadi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priests, the descendants of Levi, shall come near, for Yahweh your God has chosen them to bless in the name of Yahweh, and every legal dispute and every case of assault will be subject to their ruling.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all of the elders of that city nearest to the slain person shall wash their hands over the heifer with the broken neck in the wadi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall declare, and they shall say, ‘Our hands did not shed this blood, and our eyes did not see what was done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forgive your people, Israel, whom you redeemed, Yahweh, and do not allow the guilt of innocent blood in the midst of your people Israel, and let them be forgiven with regard to blood.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And so you shall purge the innocent blood from your midst, because you must do the right thing in the eyes of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you go out for battle against your enemies, and Yahweh your God gives them into your hand, and you lead the captives away,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you see among the captives a woman beautiful in appearance, and you become attached to her and you want to take her as a wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall bring her into your household, and she shall shave her head, and she shall trim her nails.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she shall remove the clothing of her captivity from her, and she shall remain in your house, and she shall mourn her father and her mother a full month, and after this you may have sex with her, and you may marry her, and she may become your wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then if you do not take delight in her, then you shall let her go to do whatever she wants, but you shall not treat her as a slave, since you have dishonored her.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man has two wives, and the one is loved and the other one is disliked and the one loved and the one that is disliked have borne for him sons, if it happens that the firstborn son belongs to the one that is disliked,
speaker: Narrator

text: nevertheless it will be the case that on the day of bestowing his inheritance upon his sons, he will not be allowed to treat as the firstborn son the son of the beloved wife in preference to the son of the disliked wife, who is the firstborn son.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he shall acknowledge the firstborn son of the disliked wife by giving him a double portion of all that he has, for he is the firstfruit of his vigor; to him is the legal claim of the birthright.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not listen to the voice of his father and to the voice of his mother, and they discipline him, and he does not obey them,
speaker: Narrator

text: then his father and his mother shall take hold of him, and they shall bring him out to the elders of his city and to the gate of his town,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall say to the elders of his city, ‘This our son is stubborn and rebellious; he does not obey us, and he is a glutton and a drunkard.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the men of his city shall stone him with stones and let him die; and so you shall purge the evil from your midst, and all of Israel will hear, and they will fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And if a man commits a sin punishable by death, and so he is put to death and you hang him on a tree,
speaker: Narrator

text: his dead body shall not hang on the tree, but certainly you shall bury him on that day, for cursed by God is one that is being hung; so you shall not defile your land that Yahweh your God is giving to you as an inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not watch the ox of your neighbor or his sheep or goat straying and ignore them; certainly you shall return them to your neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if your countryman is not near you or you do not know who he is, then you shall bring it to your household, and it shall be with you until your countryman seeks after it, and you shall return it to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thus also you shall do regarding his donkey, and thus you shall do concerning his garment, and so you shall do with respect to all of the lost property of your countryman that is lost from him and you find it; you are not allowed to withhold help.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not see the donkey of your neighbor or his ox fallen on the road and you ignore them; certainly you must help them get up along with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The apparel of a man shall not be put on a woman, and a man shall not wear the clothing of a woman, because everyone who does these things is detestable to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a bird’s nest is found before you on the road in any tree or on the ground, and there are chicks or eggs, and the mother is lying down on the chicks or the eggs, you shall not take the mother along with the young;
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall certainly let the mother go, but you may take the young for yourselves; do this so that it may go well for you and you may live long in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you build a new house then you shall make a parapet wall for your roof, so that you will not bring bloodguilt on your house if anyone should fall from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not sow your vineyard with differing kinds of seed, so that you shall not forfeit the whole harvest, both the seed that you sowed and the yield of the vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not plow with an ox and with a donkey yoked together.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not wear woven material made of wool and linen mixed together.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make tassels for yourselves on the four corners of your clothing with which you cover yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man takes a woman and he has sex with her, but he then dislikes her,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he accuses her falsely, and he defames her, and he says ‘This woman I took and I lay with her and I discovered that she was not a virgin,’
speaker: Narrator

text: then in defense the father of the young woman shall take, along with her mother, and together they must bring out the evidence of the virginity of the young woman to display it to the elders of the city at the city gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then the father of the young woman shall say to the elders, ‘I gave my daughter to this man as wife, but he now dislikes her,
speaker: Narrator

text: and now look he has accused her falsely, saying, “I did not find your daughter a virgin,” but here is evidence of the virginity of my daughter’; and they shall spread the cloth out before the elders of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the elders of that city shall take the man, and they shall discipline him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they shall fine him a hundred shekels of silver, and they shall give them to the father of the young woman, for he defamed an Israelite young woman, and she shall become his wife; he will not be allowed to divorce her all his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if this charge was true, and the signs of virginity were not found for the young woman,
speaker: Narrator

text: and then they shall bring out the young woman to the doorway of the house of her father, and the men of her city shall stone her with stones, and she shall die, because she did a disgraceful thing in Israel by playing the harlot in the house of her father, and so you shall purge the evil from your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man is found lying with a married woman, then they shall both die; both of them, the man who lay with the woman and the woman also, so you shall purge the evil from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If it happens that a young woman, a virgin, is engaged to a man, and a man finds her in the town and lies with her,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall bring out both of them to the gate of that city, and you shall stone them with stones so that they shall die, the young woman because she did not cry out in the town, and the man because he violated his neighbor’s wife; and so you shall purge the evil from your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if the man finds the young engaged woman in the field and the man overpowers her and he has sex with her, then the man only must die who lay with her.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall not do anything to the young woman, for there is not reckoned against the young woman a sin deserving death; it is similar to when a man rises up against his neighbor and murders him, a fellow human being, just so is this case,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he found her in the field, the engaged young woman cried out, but there was no rescuer to help her.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man finds a young woman, a virgin who is not engaged, and he seizes her and he has sex with her and they are caught,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the man who lay with her shall give to the father of the young woman fifty shekels of silver, and she shall become his wife because he violated her, and he is not allowed to divorce her during his lifetime.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man may not take the wife of his father, and so he may not dishonor his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: “No man with crushed testicles or whose male organ is cut off may come into the assembly of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: An illegitimate child may not come into the assembly of Yahweh; even to the tenth generation none of his descendants may come into the assembly of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: An Ammonite or a Moabite may not come into the assembly of Yahweh; even to the tenth generation none of his descendants may come into the assembly of Yahweh forever,
speaker: Narrator

text: because they did not come to meet you with food and with water when you came out of Egypt, and also because they hired Balaam, son of Beor, from Pethor, in Aram Naharaim to act against you to curse you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh your God was not willing to listen to Balaam, and Yahweh your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, because Yahweh your God loved you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not promote their welfare or their prosperity all your days forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not abhor an Edomite, because he is your brother; you shall not abhor an Egyptian because you were an alien in his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children that are born to them in the third generation may come representing them in the assembly of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you go out to encamp against your enemies, then you shall guard against doing anything evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If there is among you a man that is not clean because of a seminal emission during the night, he shall go outside the camp; he shall not come within the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then toward the coming of the evening, he shall bathe with water, and at the going down of the sun, he may come to the midst of the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And there shall be for you a designated place outside the camp; and you shall go there to relieve yourself,
speaker: Narrator

text: and a digging tool shall be included in addition to your other utensils for yourself; and then when you relieve yourself outside the camp you shall dig with it, and then you shall turn, and you shall cover your excrement.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God is walking about in the midst of your camp to deliver you and to hand your enemies over to you before you, and so let your camp be holy, so that he shall not see in it anything indecent, and he shall turn away from going with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And you shall not hand over a slave to his master who has escaped and fled to you from his master.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall reside with you in your midst in the place that he chooses in one of your towns wherever he pleases; you shall not oppress him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “No woman of Israel shall be a temple prostitute, and no man of Israel shall be a male shrine prostitute.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may not bring the hire of a prostitute or the earnings of a male prostitute into the house of Yahweh your God, for any vow offerings, because both are a detestable thing to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not charge your brother interest on money, interest on food, or interest on anything that one could lend on interest.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may lend on interest to the foreigner, but to your countryman you may not lend on interest, so that Yahweh your God may bless you in all your undertakings in the land where you are going, in order to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you make a vow to Yahweh your God, you shall not postpone fulfillment of it, for certainly Yahweh your God shall require it from you and if postponed you will incur guilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you refrain from vowing, you shall not incur guilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: The utterance of your lips you must perform diligently just as you have vowed freely to Yahweh your God whatever it was that you promised with your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you come into the vineyard of your neighbor, then you may eat grapes as you please and until you are full, but you shall not put any into your container.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you come into the standing grain of your neighbor, then you may pluck ears with your hand, but you may not swing a sickle among the standing grain of your neighbor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “When a man takes a wife and he marries her and then she does not please him, because he found something objectionable and writes her a letter of divorce and puts it in her hand and sends her away from his house,
speaker: Narrator

text: and she goes from his house, and she goes out and becomes a wife for another man,
speaker: Narrator

text: and then the second man dislikes her and he writes her a letter of divorce and places it into her hand and sends her from his house, or if the second man dies who took her to himself as a wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: her first husband who sent her away is not allowed to take her again to become a wife to him after she has been defiled, for that is a detestable thing before Yahweh, and so you shall not mislead into sin the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When a man takes a new wife he shall not go out with the army, and he shall not be obligated with anything; he shall be free from obligation, to stay at home for one year, and he shall bring joy to his wife that he took.
speaker: Narrator

text: “A person shall not take a pair of millstones or an upper millstone, for he is taking necessities of life as a pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man is caught kidnapping somebody from among his countrymen, the Israelites, and he treats him as a slave or he sells him, then that kidnapper shall die, and so you shall purge the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be watchful with respect to an outbreak of any infectious skin disease, by being very careful and by acting according to all that the priests and the Levites have instructed you, just as I have commanded them, so you shall diligently observe.
speaker: Narrator

text: So remember what Yahweh your God did to Miriam on the journey when you went out from Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you make a loan to your neighbor, a loan of any kind, you shall not go into his house to take his pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall wait outside, and the man to whom you are lending, he shall bring the pledge outside to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if he is a needy man, you shall not sleep in his pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall certainly return the pledge to him as the sun sets, so that he may sleep in his cloak and may bless you, and it shall be considered righteousness on your behalf before Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not exploit a hired worker, who is needy and poor, from among your fellow men or from among your aliens who are in your land and in your towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: On his day you shall give his wage, and the sun shall not go down, because he is poor and his life depends on it; do this so that he does not cry out against you to Yahweh, and you incur guilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Fathers shall not be put to death because of their children, and children shall not be put to death because of their fathers; each one shall be put to death for his own sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not subvert the rights of an alien or an orphan, and you shall not take as pledge the garment of a widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall remember that you were a slave in Egypt and that Yahweh your God redeemed you from there; therefore I am commanding you to do this commandment.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you reap your harvest in your field and you forget a sheaf in the field, you shall not return to get it, for it shall be for the alien, for the orphan, and for the widow, so that Yahweh your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you beat off the fruit of your olive trees you shall not search through the branches afterward, for it shall be for the alien, for the orphan, and for the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you harvest grapes, you shall not glean your vineyards again; it shall be for the alien, for the orphan, and for the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, therefore I am commanding you to do this thing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “When a legal dispute takes place between men and they come near to the court, and the judges judge with respect to them, then they shall declare the righteous to be in the right and they shall condemn the wicked,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it will happen if the guilty one deserves beating, then the judge shall make him lie, and he shall beat him before him, according to the prescribed number of lashes proportionate to the offense.
speaker: Narrator

text: He may beat him with forty lashes, and he shall not do more than these, so that he will not beat more in addition to these many blows, and your countryman would be degraded before your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not muzzle an ox when he is threshing.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When brothers dwell together and one of them dies and has no son, the wife of the deceased shall not become the wife of a man of another family; her brother-in-law shall have sex with her, and he shall take her to himself as a wife, and he shall perform his duty as a brother-in-law with respect to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then the firstborn that she bears shall represent his dead brother, so that his name is not blotted out from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the man does not want to take his sister-in-law, then his sister-in-law shall go up to the gate, to the elders, and she shall say, ‘My brother-in-law refused to perpetuate his brother’s name in Israel, for he is not willing to marry me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the elders of his town shall summon him and speak to him, and if he persists and says, ‘I do not desire to marry her’
speaker: Narrator

text: then his sister-in-law shall go near him before the eyes of the elders, and she shall pull off his sandal from his foot, and she shall spit in his face, and she shall declare and she shall say, ‘This is how it is done to the man who does not build the house of his brother.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And his family shall be called in Israel, ‘The house where the sandal was pulled off.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man and his brother fight each other and the wife of the one man comes near to rescue her husband from the hand of his attacker and she stretches out her hand and she seizes his genitals,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall cut off her hand; your eye shall not take pity.
speaker: Narrator

text: “There shall not be for your use in your bag two kinds of stone weights, a large one and a small one.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall not be in your house for your use two kinds of measures.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rather a full and honest weight shall be for your use; there shall be for you a full and honest measure, so that your days on the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you may be long.
speaker: Narrator

text: For detestable to Yahweh your God is everyone who is doing such things, everyone who is acting dishonestly.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Remember what Amalek did to you on the journey when you went out from Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: that he met you on the journey and attacked you, all those lagging behind you and when you were weary and worn out, and he did not fear God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Yahweh your God gives rest to you from all your enemies from around about you in the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you as an inheritance to take possession of it, you shall blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under the heavens; you shall not forget!”
speaker: Narrator

text: “And then when you come to the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you as an inheritance, and you take possession of it and you settle in it,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall take from the firstfruit of all the fruit of the ground that you harvest from your land that Yahweh your God is giving to you, and you shall put it in a basket, and you shall go to the place that Yahweh your God will choose to make his name to dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall go to the priest who is in office in those days, and you shall say, ‘I declare today to Yahweh your God that I have come into the land that Yahweh swore to our ancestors to give to us.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest takes the basket from your hand and places it before the altar of Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall declare and you shall say before your God, ‘My ancestor was a wandering Aramean, and he went down to Egypt, and there he dwelt as an alien few in number, and there he became a great nation, mighty and numerous.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Egyptians treated us badly, and they oppressed us and imposed on us hard labor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we cried to Yahweh, the God of our ancestors, and Yahweh heard our voice and saw our affliction and our toil and our oppression.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh brought us out from Egypt with a strong hand and an outstretched arm and with great terror and with signs and with wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought us to this place and gave to us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, look, I am bringing the firstfruit of the fruit of the ground that you gave to me, Yahweh,’ and you shall place it before Yahweh your God, and you shall bow down before Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall celebrate with all of the bounty that Yahweh your God gave to you and to your family, you and the Levite and the alien who is in your midst.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you are finished giving a tithe, all of the tithe of your produce in the third year, the year of the tithe, then you shall give to the Levite, to the alien, to the orphan, and to the widow, so that they may eat in your towns and they may be satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall say before Yahweh your God, ‘I have removed the sacred portion from the house and, moreover, I have given it to the Levite and to the alien and to the orphan and to the widow according to all your commandment that you commanded me; I have not transgressed any of your commandments, and I have not forgotten any of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not eaten during my time of mourning, and I have not removed anything from it while being unclean, and I have not offered any of it to someone who has died. I have listened to the voice of Yahweh my God; I have done all that you commanded me to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look down from the dwelling place of your holiness, from heaven, and bless your people Israel, and the land that you have given to us, as you swore to our ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “This day Yahweh your God is commanding you to do these rules and regulations, and you must observe them diligently with all your heart and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh you have declared today to be for you as your God, and to go in his ways and to observe his rules and his commandments and his regulations and to listen to his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh has declared you today to be for him as a people, a treasured possession, as he promised to you, and that you are to observe all his commandments,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that he then will set you high above all the nations that he has made for his praise and for fame and for honor and for you to be a holy people to Yahweh your God, as he promised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and the elders of Israel charged the people, saying, “Keep all of the commandment that I am commanding you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then on the day that you cross the Jordan to the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you, then you shall set up for yourselves large stones, and you shall paint them with lime,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall write on them all the words of this law at your crossing, so that you may come into the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you, a land flowing with milk and honey, as Yahweh, the God of your ancestors, promised to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you cross the Jordan, you shall set up these stones that I am commanding you about today on Mount Ebal, and you shall paint them with lime.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall build an altar there for Yahweh your God, an altar of stone, but you shall not use an iron tool to shape the stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must build the altar of your God with unhewn stones, and you shall sacrifice on it burnt offerings to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall sacrifice fellowship offerings, and you shall eat them there, and you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall write on the stone all of the words of this law very clearly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and the priests, the Levites, spoke to all Israel, saying, “Be silent and hear, Israel, for this day you have become a people for Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, and observe his commandments and his rules that I am commanding you today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses charged the people on that day, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “These tribes shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people when you cross the Jordan: Simeon and Levi and Judah and Issachar and Joseph and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these shall stand on Mount Ebal for delivering the curse: Reuben, Gad and Asher and Zebulun, Dan and Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Levites shall declare, and they shall say to each man of Israel with a loud voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the man that makes a divine image or a cast image, which is a detestable thing for Yahweh, the work of the hand of a skilled craftsman, and then sets it in a hiding place.’ And all the people shall respond, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who dishonors his father or his mother.’ And all of the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who moves the boundary marker of his neighbor.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who misleads a blind person on the road.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who deprives the alien, the orphan, and the widow of justice.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who lies with the wife of his father, because he has dishonored his father’s bed.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who lies with any kind of animal.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who lies with his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who lies with his mother-in-law.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who strikes down his neighbor in secret.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who takes a bribe to murder an innocent person.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Cursed be the one who does not keep the words of this law, to observe them.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: “And it will happen that if you indeed listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, to diligently observe all his commandments that I am commanding you today, then Yahweh your God will set you above all the nations of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all of these blessings shall come upon you, and they shall have an effect on you if you listen to the voice of Yahweh your God:
speaker: Narrator

text: “You will be blessed in the city, and you will be blessed in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed will be the fruit of your womb and the fruit of your ground and the fruit of your livestock, the calf of your cattle and the lambs of your flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed will be your basket and your kneading trough.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed will you be when you come in and blessed will you be when you go out.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yahweh will cause your enemies who rise up against you to be defeated before you; on one road they shall come out against you, but on seven roads they shall flee before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will command concerning you the blessing to be in your barns and in all your endeavors; and he will bless you in the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will establish you for himself as a holy people as he has sworn to you, if you keep the commandments of Yahweh your God and you walk in his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all of the peoples of the earth shall see that by the name of Yahweh you are called, and they shall fear you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh will make you successful and prosperous, in the fruit of your womb and on the land that Yahweh swore to your ancestors to give to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh shall open for you his rich storehouse, even the heavens, to give the rain for your land in its time and to bless all of the work of your hand, and you will lend to many nations; you will not borrow from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh shall make you as head and not the tail, and you shall be only at the top of the nations, and you shall not be at the bottom, if you listen to the commandments of Yahweh your God that I am commanding you today and diligently observe them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall not turn aside from any of the words that I am commanding you today to the right or left by going after other gods to serve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And then if you do not listen to the voice of Yahweh your God by diligently observing all of his commandments and his statutes that I am commanding you today, then all of these curses shall come upon you, and they shall overtake you:
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall be cursed in the city, and you shall be cursed in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Your basket shall be cursed and your kneading trough.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The fruit of your womb shall be cursed and the fruit of you ground, the calves of your cattle and the lambs of your flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall be cursed when you come in, and you shall be cursed when you go out.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yahweh will send upon you the curse, the panic, and the threat in everything that you undertake, until you are destroyed and until you perish quickly because of the evil of your deeds in that you have forsaken me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will cause the plague to cling to you until it consumes you from the land that you are going to, to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will afflict you with the wasting diseases and with the fever and with the inflammation and with the scorching heat and with the sword and with the blight and with the mildew, and they shall pursue you until you perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your heavens that are over your heads shall be like bronze, and the earth that is under you shall be like iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will change the rain of your land to fine dust and to sand; from the heaven it shall come down upon you until you are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yahweh shall cause you to be defeated before your enemies; on one road you shall go against them, but you will flee on seven roads before them, and you shall become a thing of horror to all of the kingdoms of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your dead bodies shall be as food for all of the birds of the heaven and to the animals of the earth, and there shall not be anyone to frighten them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yahweh shall afflict you with the boils of Egypt and with tumors and with the scurvy and with the skin rash that cannot be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh shall afflict you with madness and with blindness and with confusion of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall be groping at noon just as the blind person gropes in the dark, and you shall not succeed in finding your way, and you shall only be abused and robbed all the time, and there will not be anyone who will rescue you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall become engaged to a woman, but another man shall sleep with her; you shall build a house, but you shall not live in it; a vineyard you shall plant, but you shall not enjoy it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your ox shall be slaughtered before your eyes, and you shall not eat it; your donkey shall be stolen right before you, and it shall not be returned to you; your sheep and your goats shall be given to your enemies, and there shall not be anyone who rescues you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your sons and your daughters shall be given to other people, and you will be looking on longingly for them all day, but you will be powerless to do anything.
speaker: Narrator

text: A people that you do not know shall consume the harvest of your land and all your labor, and you will be only oppressed and crushed for the rest of your lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall become mad because of what your eyes shall see.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh shall strike you with grievous boils on the knees and on the upper thighs from which you will not be able to be healed, from the sole of your foot and up to your crown.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will bring you and your king whom you set up over you to a nation that you or your ancestors have not known, and there you will serve other gods of wood and stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will become a horror and a proverb and ridicule among all the peoples where Yahweh drives you there.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall carry out much seed to the field, but you shall gather little produce, for the locust shall devour it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall plant vineyards and you shall dress them, but you shall not drink wine and you shall not gather grapes, for the worm shall eat it.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be olive trees for you in all of your territory, but you shall not anoint yourself, for your olives shall drop off.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall bear sons and daughters, but they shall not be yours, for they shall go into captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cricket shall take possession of all your trees and the fruit of your ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: The alien that is in your midst shall ascend over you, higher and higher, but you shall go down lower and lower.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall lend to you, but you shall not lend to him; he shall be the head, but you shall be the tail.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And all of these curses shall come over you, and they shall pursue you, and they shall overtake you until you are destroyed, because you did not listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, by observing his commandments and his statutes that he commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall be among you as a sign and as a wonder and among your offspring forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Because of the fact that you did not serve Yahweh your God with joy and with gladness of heart for the abundance of everything,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall serve your enemies, whom Yahweh will send against you under conditions of famine, in thirst, in nakedness, and in a lack of everything; and he shall place a yoke of iron on your neck until he has destroyed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will raise up against you a nation from far off, from the end of the earth, attacking as the eagle swoops down, a nation whose language you will not understand,
speaker: Narrator

text: a grim-faced nation who does not show respect to the old and the young and does not show pity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall consume the fruit of your livestock and the fruit of your ground until you are destroyed, and who will not leave for you any grain, wine, and olive oil, calves of your herds, and lambs of your flock until it has destroyed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall besiege you in all your towns until your high and fortified walls fall, which you are trusting in throughout your land; and it shall besiege you in all of your towns in all of your land that Yahweh your God has given to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall eat the fruit of your womb, the flesh of your sons and your daughters, whom Yahweh your God gave to you, during the siege and during the distress your enemy inflicts upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The most refined and the very sensitive man among you shall be mean with his brother and against his beloved wife and against the rest of his children that he has left over,
speaker: Narrator

text: by refraining from giving to even one of them any of the meat of his children that he eats, because there is not anything that is left over for him during the siege and distress that your enemy inflicts upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The most refined and the most delicate woman among you, who shall not venture to put the sole of her foot on the ground from being so delicate and from such gentleness, shall be mean to her beloved husband and against her son and against her daughter,
speaker: Narrator

text: and even concerning her afterbirth that goes out from between her feet and also concerning her children that she bears, because she eats them for lack of anything in secret during the siege and during the distress that your enemy inflicts upon her in your towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you do not diligently observe all the words of this law written in this scroll by revering this glorious and awesome name, Yahweh your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: then Yahweh shall overwhelm you with your plagues and the plagues of your offspring, severe plagues and lasting illnesses, grievous and enduring.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he shall bring back upon you all the diseases of Egypt concerning which you were in dread because of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also any illness and any plague that is not written in the scroll of this law, he shall bring them, Yahweh, upon you until you are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall remain only a few people in place of the fact you were formerly as the stars of heaven as far as number is concerned, because you did not listen to the voice of Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then as Yahweh delighted over you to make you prosperous to make you numerous, so Yahweh shall delight over you to exterminate you and to destroy you, and so you shall be plucked from the land that you are going there to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh shall scatter you among all the nations from one end of the earth up to the other end of the earth, and there you shall serve other gods that you have not known nor your ancestors, gods of wood and stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: And among these nations you shall not find rest, and there shall not be a resting place for the sole of your foot, and Yahweh shall give you there an anxious heart and a weakening of eyes and a languishing of your inner self.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your life shall hang in doubt before you, and you shall be startled night and day, and you shall not be confident of your life.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning you shall say, ‘If only it was evening!’ and in the evening you shall say ‘If only it was morning!’ because of the dread of your heart that you shall feel, and because of the sight of your eyes that you shall see.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh shall bring you back to Egypt in ships by the route that I promised to you that ‘You shall not see it again!’ And you shall sell yourself there to your enemies as slaves and as female slaves, but there will not be a buyer.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the words of the covenant that Yahweh commanded Moses to make with the Israelites in the land of Moab besides the covenant that he made with them at Horeb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses summoned all of Israel and said to them, “You saw all that Yahweh did before your eyes in the land of Egypt and to Pharaoh and to all his servants and to all his land;
speaker: Narrator

text: that is, the great trials that your eyes saw, and those great signs and wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh has not given to you a heart to understand, or eyes to see, or ears to hear, even to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have led you forty years in the desert; your clothes have not worn out on you, and your sandal has not worn out on your foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have not eaten bread, and you have not drunk wine and strong drink, so that you may know that I am Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you came to this place then Sihon the king of Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, came out to meet you for battle, and we defeated them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites and to the Gadites and to the half-tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you must diligently observe the words of this covenant, so that you may succeed in all that you do.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are standing today, all of you, before Yahweh your God, your leaders, your tribes, your elders, and your officials, all the men of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: your little children, your women and your aliens who are in the midst of your camp, from the choppers of your wood to the drawers of your water,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order for you to enter into the covenant of Yahweh your God, and into his oath that Yahweh your God is making with you today,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order to establish you today to himself as a people and so that he may be for you as God, just as he promised to you and just as he swore to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now I am not making this covenant and this oath with you alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: But with whoever is standing here with us today before Yahweh our God, and with whoever is not standing here with us today.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you know how we lived in the land of Egypt and how we traveled through the midst of the nations that you traveled through.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you have seen their detestable things and their idols of wood and stone, silver, and gold that were among them,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that there is not among you a man or a woman or a clan or a tribe whose heart turns today from being with Yahweh our God to go to serve the gods of these nations, so that there is not among you a root sprouting poison and wormwood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then when he hears the words of this oath, then he will assure himself in his heart, saying, ‘Safety shall be mine even though I go in the stubbornness of my heart,’ thereby destroying the well-watered land along with the parched.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will not be willing to forgive him, for by then the anger of Yahweh will smoke, and his passion against that man and all the curses written in this scroll will descend on him, and Yahweh will blot out his name from under heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh will single him out for calamity out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant written in the scroll of this law.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And the next generation, that is, your children who will rise up after you, and the foreigner who will come from a distant land, when they will see the plagues of that land and its diseases that Yahweh has inflicted upon it, will say,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘All its land is brimstone and salt left by fire, none of its land will be sown, and it will not make plants sprout out and it will not grow any vegetation; it is as the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah, Adman and Zeboiim, which Yahweh overturned in his anger and in his wrath.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the nations will say, ‘Why has Yahweh done such a thing to this land? What caused the fierceness of this great anger?’
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will say, ‘It is because they abandoned the covenant of Yahweh, the God of their ancestors, which he made with them when he brought them out from the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went and served other gods and bowed down to them, gods whom they did not know them and he had not allotted to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the anger of Yahweh was kindled against that land to bring upon it all the curses written in this scroll,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Yahweh uprooted them from their land in anger and in wrath and in great fury, and he cast them into another land, just as it is today.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “The hidden things belong to Yahweh our God, but the revealed things belong to us to know and to our children forever, in order to do all the words of this law.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “And then when all of these things come upon you, the blessing and the curse that I have set before you and you call them to mind among the nations there where Yahweh your God has scattered you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you return to Yahweh and you listen to his voice according to all that I am commanding you today, both you and your children, with all your heart and with all your inner self,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Yahweh your God will restore your fortunes, and he will have compassion upon you, and he will again gather you together from all the peoples where Yahweh your God scattered you there.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Even if you are outcasts at the end of the heavens, even from there Yahweh your God shall gather you, and from there he shall bring you back.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh your God will bring you to the land that your ancestors had taken possession of, and he will make you successful, and he will make you more numerous than your ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And Yahweh your God will circumcise your heart and the heart of your offspring to love Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your inner self so that you may live.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh your God will put all these curses on your enemies and on those who hate you, on those who harassed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will again listen to the voice of Yahweh, and you will do all his commandments that I am commanding you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh your God will make you prosperous in all your undertakings, and in the fruit of your livestock and in the fruit of your ground abundantly, for Yahweh will again rejoice over you, just as he rejoiced over your ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will do this if you listen to the voice of Yahweh your God by keeping his commandment and his statutes written in the scroll of this law and if you return to Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your inner self.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For this commandment that I am commanding you today is not too wonderful for you, and it is not too far from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is not in the heavens so that you might say, ‘Who will go up for us to the heavens and get it for us and cause us to hear it, so that we may do it?’
speaker: Narrator

text: And it is not beyond the sea, so that you might say, ‘Who will cross for us to the other side of the sea and take it for us and cause us to hear it, so that we may do it?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word is very near you, even in your mouth and in your heart, so that you may do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “See, I am setting before you today life and prosperity and death and disaster;
speaker: Narrator

text: what I am commanding you today is to love Yahweh your God by going in his ways and by keeping his commandments and his statutes and his regulations, and then you will live, and you will become numerous, and Yahweh your God will bless you in the land where you are going.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, if your heart turns aside and you do not listen and you are lured away and you bow down to other gods and you serve them,
speaker: Narrator

text: I declare to you today that you will certainly perish; you will not extend your time on the land that you are crossing the Jordan to go there to take possession of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I invoke as a witness against you today the heaven and the earth: life and death I have set before you, blessing and curse. So choose life, so that you may live, you and your offspring,
speaker: Narrator

text: by loving Yahweh your God by listening to his voice and by clinging to him, for he is your life and the length of your days in order for you to live on the land that Yahweh swore to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “I am a hundred and twenty years old today; I am not able to go out and to come in any longer, and Yahweh said to me, ‘You may not cross this Jordan.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God is about to cross before you; he will destroy these nations before you, and you shall dispossess them. Joshua will be crossing before you, just as Yahweh promised.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh will do to them just as he did to Sihon and to Og, kings of the Amorites, and to their land, which he destroyed with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh will deliver them to you before you, and you shall do to them according to every commandment that I have commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be strong and be courageous; you should not be afraid, and you should not be in dread from their presence, for Yahweh your God is the one going with you; he will not leave you alone and he will not forsake you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses summoned Joshua, and he said to him in the presence of all Israel, “Be strong and be courageous, for you will go with this people into the land that Yahweh swore to their ancestors to give to them, and you will give it to them as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh is the one going before you; he will be with you, and he will not leave you alone, and he will not forsake you; you shall not be afraid, and you shall not be discouraged.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses wrote this law, and he gave it to the priests, the descendants of Levi, the ones carrying the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, and to all the elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses commanded them, saying, “At the end of seven years, in the time of the year for canceling debts during the Feast of Booths,
speaker: Narrator

text: when all Israel comes to appear before Yahweh their God at the place that he will choose, you shall read this law before all Israel in their hearing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Assemble the people, the men and the women and the little children and your aliens that are in your towns, so that they may hear and so that they may learn and they may revere Yahweh your God, and they shall diligently observe all the words of this law.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then their children, who have not known, they too may hear, and they may learn to revere Yahweh their God all the days that you live on the land that you are crossing the Jordan to get there to take possession of it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Yahweh said to Moses, “Look, you are about to die; call Joshua and present yourselves in the tent of assembly, so that I may instruct him.” So Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves in the tent of assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh appeared in the tent in a column of cloud, and the column of the cloud stood at the entrance of the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Look, you are about to lie down with your ancestors, and this people will arise and they will play the prostitute after the foreign gods of the land to which they are going.
speaker: Narrator

text: And my anger shall flare up against them on that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide my face from them, and they shall become as prey, and disasters and troubles shall find them, and they shall say on that day, ‘Is it not because our God is not in our midst that these disasters have found us?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will certainly hide my face on that day, because of all of the evil that they did because they turned to other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And so then write this song for yourselves and teach it to the Israelites; put it in their mouth, so that this song may be for me as a witness against the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when I bring them into the land that I swore to their ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey, they will eat their fill, and they will become fat, and then they will turn to other gods, and they will serve them, and they will spurn me, and they will break my covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then many disasters and troubles will come upon them, and this song will give evidence before them as a witness, because it will not be forgotten from out of the mouth of their descendants, for I know their inclination that they are having today before I have brought them into the land that I swore.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses wrote this song on that day and taught it to the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he told Joshua the son of Nun, and said to him, “Be strong and be courageous, for you shall bring the Israelites into the land that I swore to them, and I will be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And then when Moses finished writing the words of this law on the scroll until they were complete,
speaker: Narrator

text: then Moses commanded the Levites carrying the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the scroll of this law and put it at the side of the ark of the covenant of Yahweh your God, and it will be there as a witness against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know your rebellion and your stiff neck even now while I am still alive with you today, rebelling against Yahweh, and how much more after my death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Assemble to me all the elders of your tribes and your officials, so that I may speak in their ears these words, and that I may call as witness against them heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that after my death you will certainly act corruptly, and you will turn aside from the way that I have commanded you, and the disaster in the future days will befall you, because you will do evil in the eyes of Yahweh, provoking him with the work of your hands.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses spoke into the ears of the assembly of Israel the words of this song until they were complete.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak,
    and let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my teaching trickle like the dew,
    my words like rain showers on tender grass,
    and like spring showers on new growth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will proclaim the name of Yahweh;
    ascribe greatness to our God!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Like this do you treat Yahweh,
    foolish and unwise people?
Has he not, your father, created you?
    He made you, and he established you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
When the Most High apportioned the nations,
    at his dividing up of the sons of humankind,
he fixed the boundaries of the peoples,
    according to the number of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh’s portion was his people,
    Jacob the share of his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He found him in a desert land,
    and in a howling, desert wasteland;
he encircled him, he cared for him,
    he protected him like the apple of his eye.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As an eagle stirs up its nest,
    hovers over its young,
spreads out its wings, takes them,
    carries them on its pinions,
speaker: Narrator

text:
so Yahweh alone guided him,
    and there was no foreign god accompanying him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
