And he set him on the high places of the land,
    and he fed him the crops of the field,
and he nursed him with honey from crags,
    and with oil from flinty rock,
speaker: Narrator

text:
With curds from the herd,
    and with milk from the flock,
with the fat of young rams,
    and rams, the offspring of Bashan,
and with goats along with the finest kernels of wheat,
    and from the blood of grapes you drank fermented wine.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They made him jealous with strange gods;
    with detestable things they provoked him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They sacrificed to the demons, not God,
    to gods whom they had not known,
new gods who came from recent times;
    their ancestors had not known them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The rock who bore you, you neglected,
    and you forgot God, the one giving you birth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Yahweh saw, and he spurned them,
    because of the provocation of his sons and his daughters.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They annoyed me with what is not a god;
    they provoked me with their idols.
So I will make them jealous with those not a people,
    with a foolish nation I will provoke them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a fire was kindled by my anger,
    and it burned up to the depths of Sheol,
and it devoured the earth and its produce,
    and it set afire the foundation of the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will heap disasters upon them;
    my arrows I will spend on them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
From outside her boundaries the sword will make her childless,
    and from inside, terror;
both for the young man and also the young woman,
    the infant along with the gray-headed man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I thought, “I will wipe them out;
    I will make people forget they ever existed.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I had not feared a provocation of the enemy,
    lest their foes might misunderstand, 
lest they should say, “Our hand is
    triumphant, and Yahweh did not do all this.”’
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they are a nation void of sense,
    and there is not any understanding in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If only they were wise, they would understand this;
    they would discern for themselves their end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How could one chase a thousand
    and two could cause a myriad to flee,
if their Rock had not sold them,
    and Yahweh had not given them up?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the fact of the matter is,
    their rock is not like our Rock,
    and our enemies recognize this.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their wine is the poison of snakes,
    and the deadly poison of horned vipers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Is not this stored up with me,
    sealed in my treasuries?’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Vengeance belongs to me and also recompense,
    for at the time their foot slips,
because the day of their disaster is near,
    and fate comes quickly for them.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh will judge on behalf of his people,
    and concerning his servants;
he will change his mind when he sees that their power has disappeared,
    and there is no one left, confined or free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he will say, ‘Where are their gods,
    their rock in whom they took refuge?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who ate the fat of their sacrifices
    and drank the wine of their libations?
Let them rise up, and let them help you;
    Let them be to you a refuge.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For indeed I lift up my hand to heaven,
    And I promise as I live forever,
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I sharpen my flashing sword,
    and my hand takes hold of it in judgment,
I will take reprisals against my foes,
    and my haters I will repay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make my arrows drunk with blood,
    and my sword shall devour flesh with the blood of the slain,
    and captives from the heads of the leaders of the enemy.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Call for songs of joy, O nations, concerning his people,
    for the blood of his servants he will avenge,
and he will take reprisals against his foes,
    and he will make atonement for his land, his people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses came, and he spoke all the words of this song in the ears of the people; that is, he and Joshua the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Moses finished speaking all these words to all Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: then he said to them, “Take to heart all the words that I am admonishing against you today concerning which you should instruct them with respect to your children so that they will observe diligently all the words of this law,
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is not a trifling matter among you, but it is your life, and through this word you will live long in the land that you are about to cross the Jordan to get there to take possession of it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to Moses on exactly this day, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go up to this mountain of the Abarim range, Mount Nebo, which is opposite Jericho, and see the land of Canaan that I am giving to the Israelites as a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall die on that mountain that you are about to go up there, and you will be gathered to your people, just as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and he was gathered to his people,
speaker: Narrator

text: because of the fact that you broke faith with me in the midst of Israel at the waters of Meribah Kadesh, in the desert of Zin, because you did not treat me as holy in the midst of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, from afar you may view the land, but there you shall not enter there, that is, into the land that I am giving to the Israelites.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, blessed the Israelites before his death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he said,
“Yahweh came from Sinai,
    and he dawned upon them from Seir;
    he shone forth from Mount Paran,
and he came with myriads of holy ones,
    at his right hand a fiery law for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moreover, he loves his people,
    all the holy ones were in your hand,
and they bowed down to your feet,
    each one accepted directions from you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A law Moses instructed for us,
    as a possession for the assembly of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And then a king arose in Jeshurun,
    at the gathering of the leaders of the people,
    united were the tribes of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“May Reuben live, and may he not die,
    and let his number not be few.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he said this of Judah,
“Hear, O Yahweh, the voice of Judah,
    and bring him to his people;
his own hands strive for him,
    and may you be a help against his foes.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And of Levi he said,
    “Your Thummim and your Urim
are for your faithful one,
    whom you tested at Massah;
you contended with him
    at the waters of Meribah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The one saying of his father and of his mother,
    ‘I have not regarded them,’
and his brothers he did not acknowledge,
    and his children he did not know,
but rather they observed your word,
    and your covenant they kept.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They taught your regulations to Jacob,
    and your law to Israel;
they placed incense smoke before you,
    and whole burnt offerings on your altar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bless, O Yahweh, his substance,
    and with the work of his hands you must be pleased;
smite the loins of those who attack him,
    and those hating him, so that they cannot arise.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of Benjamin he said,
“The beloved of Yahweh dwells securely,
    the Most High shields all around him,
all the day,
    and between his shoulders he dwells.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And of Joseph he said,
    “Blessed by Yahweh is his land,
with the choice things of heaven,
    with dew, and with the deep lying down beneath,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and with the choice things of the fruits of the the sun,
    and with the choice things of the yield of the seasons,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and with the finest things of the ancient mountains,
    and with the choice things of the eternal hills,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and with the choice things of the earth and its fullness,
    and the favor of the one who dwelt in the bush.
Let them come to the head of Joseph,
    and to the crown of the prince among his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the firstborn of his ox, majesty belongs to him,
    and his horns are the horns of a wild ox;
with them he drives people together,
    and they are the myriads of Ephraim,
    and they are the thousands of Manasseh.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They summon people to the mountains;
    there they sacrifice the sacrifices of righteousness,
because the affluence of the seas they suck out,
    and the most hidden treasures of the sand.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And of Gad he said,

like a lion he dwells,

speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

And of Naphtali, he said,
“Oh, Naphtali, sated of favor,

take possession of the lake,

speaker: Narrator

text:
And of Asher he said,

may he be the favorite of his brothers,

text:
Your bars are iron and bronze,

speaker: Narrator

text:
“There is no one like God, O, Jeshurun,

speaker: Narrator

text:
The God of ancient time is a hiding place,

and he drove out from before you your enemy,

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Blessed are you, O Israel.

the shield of your help,

and your enemies, they shall fawn before you,

speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses went up from the desert plateau of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which is opposite Jericho, and Yahweh showed him all of the land, Gilead all the way up to Dan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all of Naphtali and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh and all of the land of Judah, up to the western sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Negev and the plain of the valley of Jericho, the city of palms, on up to Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to him, “This is the land that I swore to Abraham to Isaac and to Jacob, saying, ‘To your offspring I will give it.’ I have let you see it with your eyes, but you shall not cross into it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses, the servant of Yahweh, died there in the land of Moab according to the command of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he buried him in the valley in the land of Moab opposite Beth Peor. But until this day no one knows his burial site.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died; his sight was not impaired and his vigor had not abated.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Israelites wept concerning Moses thirty days; finally the days of weeping and mourning for Moses were completed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom because Moses had placed his hands on him, and the Israelites listened to him, and they did as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And not again has a prophet arisen in Israel like Moses, whom Yahweh knew face to face,
speaker: Narrator

text: as far as all the signs and the wonders Yahweh sent him to do in the land of Egypt, against Pharaoh and all of his servants and against all of his land,
speaker: Narrator

text: and as far as all of the mighty deeds and as far as the great awesome wonders Moses did before the eyes of all Israel.
speaker: Narrator
